Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Thumama_Stadium "Al Thumama Stadium"), [Doha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doha "Doha")\n\nAttendance: 43,102\n\nReferee: [Raphael Claus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raphael_Claus "Raphael Claus") ([Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazilian_Football_Confederation "Brazilian Football Confederation"))\n\n### Group G\n\nMain article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group G](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G "2022 FIFA World Cup Group G")\n\n[Breel Embolo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breel_Embolo "Breel Embolo") scored the only goal in Switzerland\'s 1–0 defeat of Cameroon.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-200)[Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") scored two goals as Brazil won against Serbia, with star player [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar") receiving an ankle injury.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-201) Cameroon\'s [Jean-Charles Castelletto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Charles_Castelletto "Jean-Charles Castelletto") scored the opening goal against Serbia, but they were quickly behind as Serbia scored three goals by [Strahinja Pavlović](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strahinja_Pavlovi%C4%87 "Strahinja Pavlović"), [Sergej Milinković-Savić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergej_Milinkovi%C4%87-Savi%C4%87 "Sergej Milinković-Savić"), and [Aleksandar Mitrović](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleksandar_Mitrovi%C4%87 "Aleksandar Mitrović") either side of half time. Cameroon, however, scored goals through [Vincent Aboubakar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Aboubakar "Vincent Aboubakar") and [Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Maxim_Choupo-Moting "Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting"), completing a 3–3 draw.[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-202) An 83rd-minute winner by [Casemiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") for Brazil over Switzerland was enough for them to qualify for the knockout stage.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-203) Having already qualified, Brazil were unable to win their final group game, as they were defeated by Cameroon 1–0 following a goal by [Vincent Aboubakar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Aboubakar "Vincent Aboubakar"). Already having a [yellow card](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yellow_card_(soccer) "Yellow card (soccer)"), he was later sent off for removing his shirt in celebrating the goal.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-204) Cameroon, however, did not qualify, as Switzerland defeated Serbia 3–2.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-205)\n\n[![Image 364](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg/250px-Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg)\n\nBrazil States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Soccer_Federation "United States Soccer Federation"))\n\n### Group H\n\nMain article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group H](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_H "2022 FIFA World Cup Group H")\n\nUruguay and South Korea played to a goalless draw.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-206) A goalless first half between Portugal and Ghana preceded a penalty converted by [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo "Cristiano Ronaldo") to give Portugal the lead. In scoring the goal, Ronaldo became the first man to score in five World Cups. Ghana responded with a goal by [André Ayew](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Ayew "André Ayew") before goals by [João Félix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_F%C3%A9lix "João Félix"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") by Portugal put them 3–1 ahead. [Osman Bukari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osman_Bukari "Osman Bukari") scored in the 89th minute to trail by a single goal, while [Iñaki Williams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%C3%B1aki_Williams "Iñaki Williams") had a chance to equalise for Ghana ten minutes into stoppage time, but slipped before shooting. The match finished 3–2 to Portugal.[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-207) Ghanaian [Mohammed Salisu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_Salisu "Mohammed Salisu") opened the scoring against South Korea, with [Mohammed Kudus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_Kudus "Mohammed Kudus") following it up. In the second half, [Cho Gue-sung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cho_Gue-sung "Cho Gue-sung") scored a brace for South Korea, levelling the score. Mohammed Kudus scored again in the 68th minute, winning the match 3–2 for Ghana.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-208) Portugal defeated Uruguay 2–0 with two goals from [Bruno Fernandes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Fernandes "Bruno Fernandes"), advancing them to the knockout stage.[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-209) A controversial penalty decision was called late in the game, with a suspected handball from [José María Giménez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mar%C3%ADa_Gim%C3%A9nez "José María Giménez").[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-210)[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-211) Portugal led South Korea through [Ricardo Horta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardo_Horta "Ricardo Horta") after 10 minutes. However, goals by [Kim Young-gwon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Young-gwon "Kim Young-gwon") and [Hwang Hee-chan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hwang_Hee-chan "Hwang Hee-chan") won the match 2–1 for South Korea.[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-212)[Giorgian de Arrascaeta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giorgian_de_Arrascaeta "Giorgian de Arrascaeta") scored two goals as Uruguay defeated Ghana 2–0.[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-213) However, with South Korea winning, Uruguay required another goal to progress as they finished third on goals scored.[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-214) Several Uruguay players left the pitch after the game surrounding the referees and followed them off the pitch.[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-215)[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-216)[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-217)\n\n[![Image 396](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32%2C_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32%2C_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32,_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg)\n\nPortugal v Uruguay\n\n| Pos | Team * [v](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_group_tables "Template:2022 FIFA World Cup group tables") * "Facundo Tello") ([Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association "Argentine Football Association"))\n\nKnockout stage\n--------------\n\nMain article: [2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage")\n\nIn the knockout stage, if the scores were equal when normal playing time expired, [extra time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(Association_football) "Overtime (Association football)") was played for two periods of 15 minutes each. This was followed, if required, by a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") to determine the winners.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-regulations-143)\n\nAll times are local, [AST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabia_Standard_Time "Arabia Standard Time") ([UTC+3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTC%2B03:00 "UTC+03:00")).\n\n### Bracket\n\n[Round of "Switzerland national football team")1\n\n### Round of 16\n\nThe round of 16 was played from 3 to 7 December,[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-36) which for the first time ever included teams from [the Americas and four other continents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number "Continent").[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-218) Group A winners Netherlands scored goals through [Memphis Depay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis_Depay "Memphis Depay"), [Daley Blind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daley_Blind "Daley Blind"), and [Denzel Dumfries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denzel_Dumfries "Denzel Dumfries") as they defeated the United States 3–1, with [Haji Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haji_Wright "Haji Wright") scoring for the United States.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-219) Messi scored his third of the tournament alongside [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") to give Argentina a two-goal lead over Australia, and despite an Enzo Fernández own goal from a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") shot, Argentina won 2–1.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-220)[Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud")\'s goal and Mbappé\'s brace enabled France to have a 3–1 victory over Poland, with [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski") scoring the lone goal for Poland from a penalty.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-221) England beat Senegal 3–0, with goals coming from [Jordan Henderson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan_Henderson "Jordan Henderson"), [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane"), and [Bukayo Saka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukayo_Saka "Bukayo Saka").[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-222)[Daizen Maeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daizen_Maeda "Daizen Maeda") scored for Japan against Croatia in the first half before a leveller from [Ivan Perišić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Peri%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Ivan Perišić") in the second. Neither team could find the winner, with Croatia defeating Japan 3–1 in a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)").[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-223)[Vinícius Júnior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin%C3%ADcius_J%C3%BAnior "Vinícius Júnior"), [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar"), [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison"), and [Lucas Paquetá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucas_Paquet%C3%A1 "Lucas Paquetá") all scored for Brazil, but a volley from South Korean [Paik Seung-ho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paik_Seung-ho "Paik Seung-ho") reduced the deficit to 4–1.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-224)[Pablo Sarabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Sarabia "Pablo Sarabia") had the best chance for Spain to break the deadlock against Morocco in stoppage time after two goalless hours, but he hit the goalie\'s right-hand post after a shot from the left; Morocco won the match 3–0 on penalties.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-225) A [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") by [Gonçalo Ramos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gon%C3%A7alo_Ramos "Gonçalo Ramos") led Portugal to defeat Switzerland 6–1, with goals from Portugal\'s [Pepe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepe_(footballer,_born_1983) "Pepe (footballer, born 1983)"), [Raphaël Guerreiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapha%C3%ABl_Guerreiro "Raphaël Guerreiro"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") and from Switzerland\'s [Manuel Akanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Akanji "Manuel Akanji").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-226)\n\n3 December 2022(2022-12-03)\n\n18:00\n\n| [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team "Netherlands national football team")![Image 458](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Flag_of_the_Netherlands.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_Netherlands.svg.png) | [3–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Netherlands_vs_United_States "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") | ![Image 459](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png)[United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_men%27s_national_soccer_team "United States men\'s national soccer team") |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| * ([Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexican_Football_Federation "Mexican Football Federation"))\n\n### Quarter-finals\n\nThe quarter-finals were played on 9 and 10 December.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-36) Croatia and Brazil ended 0–0 after 90 minutes and went to extra time. Neymar scored for Brazil in the 15th minute of extra time. Croatia, however, equalised through [Bruno Petković](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Petkovi%C4%87 "Bruno Petković") in the second period of extra time. With the match tied, a penalty shootout decided the contest, with Croatia winning the shootout 4–2.[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-227)[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-228) In the second quarter-final match, [Nahuel Molina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nahuel_Molina "Nahuel Molina") and Messi scored for Argentina before [Wout Weghorst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wout_Weghorst "Wout Weghorst") equalised with two goals shortly before the end of the game. The match went to extra time and then penalties, where Argentina would go on to win 4–3.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-229) Morocco defeated Portugal 1–0, with [Youssef En-Nesyri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssef_En-Nesyri "Youssef En-Nesyri") scoring at the end of the first half. Morocco became the first African and the first Arab nation to advance as far as the semi-finals of the competition.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-230) Despite [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane") scoring a penalty for England, it was not enough to beat France, who won 2–1 by virtue of goals from [Aurélien Tchouaméni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lien_Tchouam%C3%A9ni "Aurélien Tchouaméni") and [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") and a late missed penalty by Kane, sending them to their second consecutive World Cup semi-final and becoming the first defending champions to reach this stage since Brazil in 1998.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-231)[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-232)\n\n9 December 2022(2022-12-09)\n\n18:00\n\n| [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team")![Image 514](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Croatia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Croatia.svg.png) | [1–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Croatia_vs_Brazil "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") 515](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/40px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png)[Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team") |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| [Petković](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Petkovi%C4%87 "Bruno Petković")![Image [Report](https://www.fifa.com/fifaplus/en/match-centre/match/17/255711/285074/400128141) | [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar")![Image [Penalties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") |\n| * [Vlašić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Vla%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Nikola Vlašić")![Image 518: soccer ball with check mark](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Soccerball_shad_check.svg/20px-Soccerball_shad_check.svg.png) * Semi-finals\n\nThe semi-finals were played on 13 and 14 December.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-36) Messi scored a penalty kick before [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") scored twice to give Argentina a 3–0 victory over Croatia.[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-233)[Théo Hernandez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") scored after five minutes as France led Morocco for most of the game. [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") scored in the 78th minute to complete a 2–0 victory for France over Morocco as they reached their second consecutive final.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-234)\n\n13 December 2022(2022-12-13)\n\n22:00\n\n| The two teams had played against each other in their [opening game in Group F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_F#Morocco_vs_Croatia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group F") which finished 0–0. [Joško Gvardiol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%C5%A1ko_Gvardiol "Joško Gvardiol") promptly scored for Croatia, with [Achraf Dari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Achraf_Dari "Achraf Dari") equalising just 2 minutes later. [Mislav Oršić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mislav_Or%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Mislav Oršić") scored the winner for Croatia as the match finished 2–1.[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-235) Morocco earned 4th place, a record for the team and the best World Cup finish of any African or Arab nation.[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-236)\n\n17 December 2022(2022-12-17)\n\n18:00\n\n| [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team")![Image 557](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Croatia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Croatia.svg.png) | [2–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Third_place_play-off "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") | ![Image 558](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Flag_of_Morocco.svg/40px-Flag_of_Morocco.svg.png)[Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| * [Gvardiol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%C5%A1ko_Gvardiol "Joško Gvardiol")![Image 559](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/Soccerball_shade.svg/20px-Soccerball_shade.svg.png)7\' * [Oršić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mislav_Or%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Mislav Oršić")![Image 560](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/Soccerball_shade.svg/20px-Soccerball_shade.svg.png)42\' | Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khalifa_International_Stadium "Khalifa International Stadium"), [Al Rayyan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Rayyan_(city) "Al Rayyan (city)")\n\nAttendance: 44,137\n\nReferee: [Abdulrahman Al-Jassim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abdulrahman_Al-Jassim "Abdulrahman Al-Jassim") ([Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_Football_Association "Qatar Football Association"))\n\n### Final\n\nMain article: [2022 FIFA World Cup final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2022 FIFA World Cup final")\n\nThe final was played on 18 December between Argentina and France. Both teams had won the event twice previously.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final1-237) Early goals from Lionel Messi and [Ángel Di María](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81ngel_Di_Mar%C3%ADa "Ángel Di María") gave Argentina, leading 2–0, a head start against the French.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final1-237)[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) Despite substitutions in the first half, France did not record a shot until after the 70th minute but were energised by additional substitutions in the 71st. A few minutes later, France were awarded a penalty as [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") was brought down in the penalty area by [Nicolás Otamendi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Otamendi "Nicolás Otamendi"). Mbappé scored the penalty and added a second goal less than two minutes later to equalise the scores.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) With the score tied at two goals apiece, the match went to extra time. Messi scored his second goal in the 108th minute, once again giving Argentina the lead. However, Mbappé was awarded a second penalty in the 115th minute after his shot hit the arm of [Gonzalo Montiel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gonzalo_Montiel "Gonzalo Montiel"). Mbappé scored his third goal, becoming the second player ever to complete a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") in the final of a World Cup after [Geoff Hurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Hurst "Geoff Hurst") for England in [1966](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup "1966 FIFA World Cup").[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) With the score tied at 3–3, the match was determined via a penalty shootout. Argentina won the final after scoring all of their penalties, winning 4–2.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) This marked their third World Cup win and their first since [1986](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup "1986 FIFA World Cup"), and also the second team (after [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team "Spain national football team") in [2010](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup")) to win the tournament after having lost their opening game.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238)\n\n18 December 2022(2022-12-18)\n\n18:00\n\n| 562](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png) | [3–3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Final "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") ([a.e.t.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football "Overtime (sports)")) | ![Image 563](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png)[France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| * [Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi")![Image 566](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/Soccerball_shade.svg/20px-Soccerball_shade.svg.png)80\'([pen.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football) "Penalty kick (association football)")), 81\', 118\'([pen.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football) "Penalty kick (association football)")) |\n| [Penalties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") |\n| * [Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel ([Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_Football_Association "Polish Football Association"))\n\nStatistics\n----------\n\nSee also: [FIFA World Cup records and statistics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_records_and_statistics "FIFA World Cup records and statistics")\n\n### Goalscorers\n\nNote: Goals scored in penalty shoot-outs are not counted towards players\' goal counts or to match goal counts.\n\n[![Image 575](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_(7)_(cropped).jpg)\n\nFrance forward [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") won the [Golden Boot award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") after scoring eight goals in the tournament, the most since [Ronaldo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer) "Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)") in [2002](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup "2002 FIFA World Cup").\n\nThere were 172 goals scored in 64 matches, for an average of 2.69 goals per match.\n\nTwo own goals were scored throughout the tournament.[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-239)\n\nThis was the most goals ever scored at a FIFA World Cup.[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-240)\n\n**8 goals**\n\n*   [![Image 576: France national football 695](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg/250px-Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)\n\nArgentina captain and forward [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the [Golden Ball award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball"), becoming the first player to win it twice.\n\nThe following [World Cup awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards "FIFA World Cup awards") were given at the conclusion of the tournament: the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") (top scorer), [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") (best overall player) and [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") (best goalkeeper).[[241]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-246)\n\n| [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") | Silver Ball | Bronze Ball |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| [![Image 696: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") | [![Image 697: France national football team")[Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") * * * 4 goals, 0 assists |\n| [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") |\n| [![Image 702: Argentina national football team](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Flag_of_Argentina.svg/40px-Flag_of_Argentina.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team")[Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") |\n| [FIFA Fair Play Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Fair_Play_Trophy "FIFA World Cup Fair Play Trophy") |\n| ![Image 704](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/40px-Flag_of_England.svg.png)[England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") |\n\nAdditionally, FIFA.com shortlisted 10 goals for users to vote on as the tournament\'s best. The award was won by Brazil\'s [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") for his second goal in the [group stage match against Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G#Brazil_vs_Serbia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group G").[[242]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-247)\n\nMarketing\n---------\n\n### Branding\n\nThe official emblem was designed by Unlock Brands[[243]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-248) and unveiled in September 2019, during simultaneous events at the [Doha Tower](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doha_Tower "Doha Tower"), [Katara Cultural Village](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katara_Cultural_Village "Katara Cultural Village") amphitheatre, [Msheireb Downtown Doha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Msheireb_Downtown_Doha "Msheireb Downtown Doha"), and [Zubarah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zubarah "Zubarah"). It is based on a [shawl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawl "Shawl") (reflecting upon the tournament\'s late-Autumn scheduling) and desert [dunes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dune "Dune"), and was shaped to resemble the [tournament trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Trophy "FIFA World Cup Trophy"), the [infinity symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity_symbol "Infinity symbol"), and the number "8"—reflecting upon the "interconnected" event and the eight host stadiums. The typography of the emblem\'s [wordmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wordmark "Wordmark") incorporated [kashida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashida "Kashida")—the practice of elongating certain parts of characters in [Arabic script](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabic_script "Arabic script") to provide typographical emphasis.[[244]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-249)[[245]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-250)[[246]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-251)\n\nH.E Ambassador Dr. Hend Al-Muftah, Permanent Representative of the State of Qatar to the United Nations Office at Geneva, explained to [WIPO Magazine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WIPO_Magazine "WIPO Magazine") that the tournament provided an opportunity to "promote our culture and showcase our signature hospitality in a multicultural environment", and highlighted that the country has [used sports to](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_and_sports "Politics and sports") demonstrate its "commitment to sustainable development, social inclusion and the values of community and mutual respect among peoples from different cultures and nations."[[247]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-252)\n\n### Merchandise\n\nSee also: [FIFA World Cup video games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_video_games "FIFA World Cup video games")\n\n[Electronic Arts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electronic_Arts "Electronic Arts")\' licensed video games _[FIFA Mobile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA\\_Mobile "FIFA Mobile")_ and _[FIFA 23](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA\\_23 "FIFA 23")_ (except on [Nintendo Switch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nintendo_Switch "Nintendo Switch")) received free updates with tie-in content for the 2022 World Cup on 8 and 9 November 2022, respectively. The update for _FIFA 23_ added World Cup-themed tournament modes with all teams and two of the stadiums from the event, campaigns and World Cup-themed unlockable content for Ultimate Team mode, and real-time squad and fixture updates during the tournament.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-253)\n\nOn 24 August 2022, the [Panini Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panini_Group "Panini Group") produced themed stickers and a [sticker album](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sticker_album "Sticker album") for a 14th consecutive World Cup. This year, rare cards with coloured borders were included and could be collected, [traded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_cards "Trading cards"), or sold.[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-254)\n\nOn 12 April 2022, [FIFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA "FIFA") released an [over-the-top media service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Over-the-top_media_service "Over-the-top media service") and app revolving around the World Cup called FIFA+, where fans could play games, predict matches, and compete with others.[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-255)\n\n### Broadcasting rights\n\nMain article: [2022 FIFA World Cup broadcasting rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_broadcasting_rights "2022 FIFA World Cup broadcasting rights")\n\nIn May 2022, Infantino projected that the 2022 FIFA World Cup could be the most-watched in its history, with a global audience of at least 5 billion. The 2018 tournament was seen by 3.57 billion across the tournament.[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-256) The various controversies surrounding the World Cup in Qatar led to questions over how the tournament would be covered in the media, and whether they would be discussed or addressed during coverage.[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-257)[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:1-258) The match between England and the United States in the group stage was seen by approximately 20 million viewers across both Fox and [Telemundo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemundo "Telemundo"), ranking among the highest-rated associated football broadcasts in the United States (behind a 2014 World Cup match that drew 24.7 million).[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-259)[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-260)\n\n### Sponsorship\n\n| FIFA partners | FIFA
