[Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final)\nControversies\n\n*   [Overview](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_controversies "List of 2022 FIFA World Cup controversies")\n*   [Allegations of corruption and bribery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allegations_of_corruption_and_bribery_related_to_the_2022_FIFA_World_Cup "Allegations of corruption and bribery related to the 2022 FIFA World Cup")\n    *   "[FIFA\'s Dirty Secrets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA%27s_Dirty_Secrets "FIFA\'s Dirty Secrets")"\n    *   [Garcia Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garcia_Report "Garcia Report")\n    *   [2015 FIFA corruption case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_corruption_case "2015 FIFA corruption case")\n    *   [European Parliament corruption scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_corruption_scandal_at_the_European_Parliament "Qatar corruption scandal at the European Parliament")\n\n*   [Criticisms of Qatar\'s suitability to host](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticisms_of_Qatar%27s_suitability_to_host_the_2022_FIFA_World_Cup "Criticisms of Qatar\'s suitability to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup")\n*   [Human rights issues](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_issues_involving_the_2022_FIFA_World_Cup "Human rights issues involving the 2022 FIFA World Cup")\n    *   [Death of Marc Bennett](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Marc_Bennett "Death of Marc Bennett")\n    *   [Kafala system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kafala_system "Kafala system")\n\n*   [LGBT issues](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_issues_at_the_2022_FIFA_World_Cup "LGBT issues at the 2022 FIFA World Cup")\n    *   [_in_ Group B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_B#LGBT_symbol_incidents "2022 FIFA World Cup Group B")\n    *   [LGBT rights in Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Qatar "LGBT rights in Qatar")\n    *   [OneLove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OneLove "OneLove")\n\n*   [Qatar diplomatic crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_diplomatic_crisis "Qatar diplomatic crisis")\nPeople\n\n*   [Gianni Infantino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gianni_Infantino "Gianni Infantino")\n*   [Antonio Mateu Lahoz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Mateu_Lahoz "Antonio Mateu Lahoz")\n*   [Szymon Marciniak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szymon_Marciniak "Szymon Marciniak")\n*   [Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamim_bin_Hamad_Al_Thani "Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani")\n*   [Grant Wahl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_Wahl "Grant Wahl")\n*   [Squads](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_squads "2022 FIFA World Cup squads")\n*   [Officials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_officials "2022 FIFA World Cup officials")\nPromotional and related media\n\n*   [Adidas _Al Rihla_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Al_Rihla "Adidas Al Rihla")\n*   [_FIFA 23_ downloadable content](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_23#World_Cup_game_modes "FIFA 23")\n*   Music \n    *   _[FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 Official Soundtrack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA\\_World\\_Cup\\_Qatar\\_2022\\_Official\\_Soundtrack "FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 Official Soundtrack")_\n    *   "[Hayya Hayya (Better Together)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayya_Hayya_(Better_Together) "Hayya Hayya (Better Together)")"\n    *   "[Three Lions (It\'s Coming Home for Christmas)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Lions_(song)#%22Three_Lions_(It\'s_Coming_Home_for_Christmas)%22 "Three Lions (song)")"\n    *   "[Tukoh Taka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tukoh_Taka "Tukoh Taka")"\n    *   "[World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Cup_(song) "World Cup (song)")"\n![Image 8](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png)\n\nMedia related to [2022 FIFA World Cup](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:2022_FIFA_World_Cup "commons:Category:2022 FIFA World Cup") at Wikimedia Commons\n*   [v](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_sidebar "Template:2022 FIFA World Cup sidebar")\n*   [t](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template_talk:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_sidebar "Template talk:2022 FIFA World Cup sidebar")\n*   [e](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:EditPage/Template:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_sidebar "Special:EditPage/Template:2022 FIFA World Cup sidebar")\n\nThe **2022 FIFA World Cup final** was the final match of the [2022 FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"), the 22nd edition of [FIFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA "FIFA")\'s competition for [men\'s national football teams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_national_association_football_teams "List of men\'s national association football teams"). The match was played at [Lusail Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium") in [Lusail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail "Lusail"), Qatar, on 18 December 2022, [the Qatari National Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Day_(Qatar) "National Day (Qatar)"), and was contested by [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") and defending champions [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team"). With a record 1.5 billion people watching on television, the final became one of the most widely watched televised sporting events in history.[[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-3)\n\nThe tournament comprised hosts [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_national_football_team "Qatar national football team") and 31 other teams who emerged victorious from [the qualification phase](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification "2022 FIFA World Cup qualification"), organised by the six [FIFA confederations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_football_federations#FIFA_Confederations "List of football federations"). The 32 teams competed in a group stage, from which 16 teams qualified for [the knockout stage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage"). En route to the final, Argentina finished first in [Group C](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C"), first losing to Saudi Arabia 2–1, then defeating both [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team "Mexico national football team") and [Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team "Poland national football team") 2–0. They then beat [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national soccer team") 2–1 in the round of 16, the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team "Netherlands national football team") in the quarter-final through a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") after it ended 2–2 in extra time, and [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team") in the semi-final 3–0. France finished first in [Group D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D") with two wins and one loss (4–1 win over [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national soccer team"), 2–1 win over [Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denmark_national_football_team "Denmark national football team"), and a 1–0 loss to [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia_national_football_team "Tunisia national football team")), defeating Poland 3–1 in the round of 16, [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") 2–1 in the quarter-final, and [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") 2–0 in the semi-final. The final took place in front of 88,966 spectators and was [refereed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Referee_(association_football) "Referee (association football)") by [Szymon Marciniak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szymon_Marciniak "Szymon Marciniak").\n\nArgentina took the lead through a [penalty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football) "Penalty kick (association football)") by [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") in the 23rd minute before [Ángel Di María](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81ngel_Di_Mar%C3%ADa "Ángel Di María") further increased their lead in the 36th minute with a low shot into the corner of the goal after a sweeping Argentina counterattack. France failed to register a shot at the goal for the vast majority of the match until a 97-second brace by [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") tied the game 2–2 in the 81st minute. During [extra time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football "Overtime (sports)"), Messi then scored again to give Argentina a 3–2 lead. However, Mbappé scored a second penalty to tie the game 3–3 with just a few minutes remaining, becoming the second man to score a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick_(association_football) "Hat-trick (association football)") in a World Cup final after [Geoff Hurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Hurst "Geoff Hurst") in [1966](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup_final "1966 FIFA World Cup final"). Argentina then won the ensuing penalty shoot-out 4–2 to win their third World Cup, and first since [1986](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup "1986 FIFA World Cup").\n\nIt was the second time that Argentina reached the World Cup final after losing their opening match (the other occasion being in [1990](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1990_FIFA_World_Cup "1990 FIFA World Cup")), a feat three other teams have achieved ([West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team "Germany national football team") in [1982](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1982_FIFA_World_Cup "1982 FIFA World Cup"), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy_national_football_team "Italy national football team") in [1994](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1994_FIFA_World_Cup "1994 FIFA World Cup"), and [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team "Spain national football team") in [2010](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup")); it was only the second time in history that a team went on to win the tournament after losing their opening match (following Spain in 2010). France became the first team in history to score three goals in a World Cup final and lose. Messi was named the [man of the match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Player_of_the_match "Player of the match") and won the [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup awards") as FIFA\'s best player of the tournament, becoming the first player to win the award twice, having previously won it in [2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup "2014 FIFA World Cup").\n\nThe match was ranked by the football media and fans alike as one of the greatest [World Cup finals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIFA_World_Cup_finals "List of FIFA World Cup finals"), and one of the greatest football matches in the history of the sport.[[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-4)[[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-5)\n\nBackground\n----------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Background")]\n\n[Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") had won the World Cup twice before, in [1978](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1978_FIFA_World_Cup "1978 FIFA World Cup") and [1986](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup "1986 FIFA World Cup").[[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-6) They had also finished as losing finalists three times, in [1930](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1930_FIFA_World_Cup_final "1930 FIFA World Cup final"), [1990](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1990_FIFA_World_Cup_final "1990 FIFA World Cup final") and [2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2014 FIFA World Cup final"). After the 2014 final loss, they went on to lose two consecutive [Copa América](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica "Copa América") finals to [Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile_national_football_team "Chile national football team"), in [2015](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Final "2015 Copa América Final") and [2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario_Final "Copa América Centenario Final"). After a string of disappointing performances in the 2018 FIFA World Cup, where they lost to eventual champions France in the [first knockout round](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#France_vs_Argentina "2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage"), and the [2019 Copa América](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica "2019 Copa América"),[[7]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-7) where they finished [third](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_knockout_stage#Third_place_play-off "2019 Copa América knockout stage"), newly appointed coach [Lionel Scaloni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni "Lionel Scaloni") led Argentina to their first international title since [1993](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1993_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica "1993 Copa América") by defeating title holders Brazil 1–0 in the [2021 Copa América final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_final "2021 Copa América final") and handing captain [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") his first senior international title.[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-8)[[9]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-9) After winning the [2022 Finalissima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Finalissima "2022 Finalissima"), beating [European champions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020_final "UEFA Euro 2020 final") Italy 3–0,[[10]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-10) Argentina entered Qatar as one of the favourites to win.[[11]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-11)[[12]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-12)\n\n[France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") were the defending champions from the [2018 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup"), which made this the first time since the [2002 final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2002 FIFA World Cup final") in which a team had consecutive appearances at the finals, and the first since [1998](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "1998 FIFA World Cup Final") in which the title holders qualified for the subsequent final – both feats achieved by [Brazil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team"). France had claimed two World Cups, in [1998](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup "1998 FIFA World Cup") and 2018. The French also reached the [2006 final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "2006 FIFA World Cup Final"), but fell to [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy_national_football_team "Italy national football team") on [penalties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)"). Under the management of [Didier Deschamps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didier_Deschamps "Didier Deschamps"), who won the 1998 tournament as a player, the French failed to conquer the [2014 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup "2014 FIFA World Cup") and [UEFA Euros 2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016 "UEFA Euro 2016") and [2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020 "UEFA Euro 2020"), but successfully clinched the 2018 World Cup title.[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-13)[[14]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-14) Due to their status as the world champions, France also entered Qatar as one of the favourites to win.[[15]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-15) France aimed to emulate the achievement of Italy in [1934](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1934_FIFA_World_Cup "1934 FIFA World Cup") and [1938](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1938_FIFA_World_Cup "1938 FIFA World Cup") and Brazil in [1958](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup "1958 FIFA World Cup") and [1962](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1962_FIFA_World_Cup "1962 FIFA World Cup") as the third country to successfully defend the World Cup title. Deschamps was seeking to become the second manager to win two men\'s [FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup "FIFA World Cup") titles, after [Vittorio Pozzo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vittorio_Pozzo "Vittorio Pozzo") with Italy in 1934 and 1938.[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-16) Having won the 1998 tournament as a player, Deschamps was also seeking to become the third person to win three FIFA World Cup titles, after Brazilian legends [Pelé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé") (all as a player) and [Mário Zagallo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A1rio_Zagallo "Mário Zagallo") (two as a player, one as a manager).[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-17)[[18]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-18)\n\n[![Image 9](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Argentina_vs_France_2018_World_Cup_28.jpg/250px-Argentina_vs_France_2018_World_Cup_28.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Argentina_vs_France_2018_World_Cup_28.jpg)\n\nArgentina v France match in the round of 16 of the [2018 FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup") in Russia\n\nThe two nations met in the knockout stage for the second straight World Cup. In 2018 in Russia at the [Kazan Arena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazan_Arena "Kazan Arena") in the round of 16, France won the encounter 4–3 in what _[The Independent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\\_Independent "The Independent")_ called "one of the greatest World Cup games of all time".[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-19)[Antoine Griezmann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoine_Griezmann "Antoine Griezmann") opened the scoring with a penalty before [Ángel Di María](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81ngel_Di_Mar%C3%ADa "Ángel Di María") and [Gabriel Mercado](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Mercado "Gabriel Mercado") put Argentina in front, with France then scoring the next three goals courtesy of [Benjamin Pavard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Pavard "Benjamin Pavard")\'s volley outside of the box – which was later voted as the goal of the tournament[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-20) – and then [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") twice.[[21]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-21)[Sergio Agüero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergio_Ag%C3%BCero "Sergio Agüero") reduced the deficit to one in stoppage time, but Argentina was unable to equalise and send the match to [extra time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football "Overtime (sports)").[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-22)\n\nThe match ball for the [2022 FIFA World Cup semi-finals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Semi-finals "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage"), [third place match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Third_place_play-off "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") and final was announced on 11 December 2022. It was a variation of the [Adidas _Al Rihla_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Al_Rihla "Adidas Al Rihla") used in the rest of the tournament named the [Adidas _Al-Hilm_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Al_Rihla#Final_matches_%E2%80%93_Al_Hilm "Adidas Al Rihla"), meaning "The Dream" in [Arabic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabic "Arabic"), a reference to every nation\'s dream of lifting the FIFA World Cup.[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-23) Whilst the technical aspects of the ball are the same, the colour is different from the _Al-Rihla_ balls used in the group stages and preceding knockout games, with a _Gold Metallic_, maroon, _Collegiate Burgundy_, and red design, a reference to the [national colours](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Qatar "Flag of Qatar") of host nation [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar "Qatar") and the golden colours shared by the final\'s venue [Lusail Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail_Stadium "Lusail Stadium") and the [FIFA World Cup Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Trophy "FIFA World Cup Trophy"). It is the fifth special ball for FIFA World Cup final matches, after the [+Teamgeist Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Teamgeist#World_Cup_match_balls "Adidas Teamgeist"),[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-ball-24)[Jo\'bulani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Jabulani#Colouring "Adidas Jabulani"),[[25]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-jobulani-25)[Brazuca Final Rio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Brazuca#Final_match_%E2%80%93_Brazuca_Final_Rio "Adidas Brazuca"),[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-26) and [Telstar Mechta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Telstar_18#Telstar_Mechta "Adidas Telstar 18").[[27]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-27)\n\nVenue\n-----\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Venue")]\n\nThe final was played at Lusail Stadium in [Lusail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lusail "Lusail"), Qatar, located about 15 kilometres (9.3 mi) north of the city centre of [Doha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doha "Doha").[[28]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-28) The stadium was intended to host the final as part of [Qatar\'s World Cup bid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_2022_FIFA_World_Cup_bid "Qatar 2022 FIFA World Cup bid"),[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-29) and was confirmed as the final venue on 15 July 2020.[[30]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-30) The stadium was allocated to also host nine previous World Cup matches, with six in the group stage and three other knockout fixtures.[[31]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-match_schedule-31)\n\nLusail Stadium, owned by the [Qatar Football Association](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_Football_Association "Qatar Football Association"), was built as part of Qatar\'s winning bid for the World Cup. The stadium was designed by British firm [Foster and Partners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foster_and_Partners "Foster and Partners") and [Populous](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Populous_(company) "Populous (company)"),[[32]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-32) supported by [MANICA Architecture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MANICA_Architecture "MANICA Architecture").[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-33) The stadium uses solar power to be cooled and is claimed to have a carbon zero footprint.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-34) Construction began in April 2017,[[35]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-35) and was planned to finish in 2020. Completion of the stadium was postponed, with construction ultimately finished in November 2021.[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-36) The stadium hosted its first match, the Lusail Super Cup, on 9 September 2022,[[37]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-37) later than expected.[[38]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-38)\n\nRoute to the final\n------------------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: Route to the final")]\n\n### Argentina\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: Argentina")]\n\nArgentina\'s route to the final |  | Opponent | Result |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| 1 | ![Image 10](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Flag_of_Saudi_Arabia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Saudi_Arabia.svg.png)[Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia_national_football_team "Saudi Arabia national football team") | [1–2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C#Argentina_vs_Saudi_Arabia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C") |\n| 2 | ![Image 11](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Flag_of_Mexico.svg/40px-Flag_of_Mexico.svg.png)[Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team "Mexico national football team") | [2–0](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C#Argentina_vs_Mexico "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C") |\n| 3 | ![Image 12](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/40px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png)[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team "Poland national football team") | [2–0](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C#Poland_vs_Argentina "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C") |\n| R16 | ![Image 13](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png)[Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national soccer team") | [2–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Argentina_vs_Australia "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") |\n| QF | ![Image 14](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Flag_of_the_Netherlands.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_Netherlands.svg.png)[Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team "Netherlands national football team") | [2–2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Netherlands_vs_Argentina "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") ([a.e.t.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football "Overtime (sports)")) (4–3 [p](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)")) |\n| SF | ![Image 15](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Croatia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Croatia.svg.png)[Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team") | [3–0](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Argentina_vs_Croatia "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") |\n\nDrawn in [group C](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C") and coming off a three-year, 36-game-long unbeaten streak,[[39]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-39) Argentina were defeated in their opening game 2–1 by [Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia_national_football_team "Saudi Arabia national football team").[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-40)[[41]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-41) Lionel Messi\'s opener from the penalty spot was followed by several disallowed Argentina goals which were ruled offside.[[42]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-42) Immediately after half-time, Saudi Arabia stunned Argentina with two goals from [Saleh Al-Shehri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saleh_Al-Shehri "Saleh Al-Shehri") and [Salem Al-Dawsari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salem_Al-Dawsari "Salem Al-Dawsari") in a span of five minutes before shutting out any further attempts by the South Americans in a disciplined defensive performance.[[43]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-43) However, the Argentines bounced back from the shock loss to overcome [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team "Mexico national football team") 2–0 after a long-range effort by Messi who then assisted [Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") for the second, reigniting their World Cup hopes.[[44]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-44) Boosted by the win, Argentina then beat Poland with the same scoreline with goals from [Alexis Mac Allister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Mac_Allister "Alexis Mac Allister") and [Julián Alvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_Alvarez "Julián Alvarez") despite a first-half penalty miss from Messi, taking first place in Group C and condemning both Mexico and Saudi Arabia to World Cup elimination.[[45]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-45)\n\nIn the round of 16, the Argentines found themselves matched against [group D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D") runners-up [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national soccer team"); Messi\'s first-ever knockout-stage goal was followed by an astute goal by Alvarez, who intercepted Australian goalkeeper [Mathew Ryan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathew_Ryan "Mathew Ryan") to finish into an empty net as Argentina overcame Australia 2–1, despite an own goal from Fernández creating a frantic finish which required a late save from point-blank range by [Emiliano Martínez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez").[[46]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-46) Continuing a [rivalry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina-Netherlands_football_rivalry "Argentina-Netherlands football rivalry"), they proceed to square off against the [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team "Netherlands national football team") in the quarter-finals. In a [controversial match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Lusail "Battle of Lusail") noted for its dramatic nature, chaotic atmosphere, and fury between both teams,[[47]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-47)[[48]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-48) it saw Argentina lead by two goals coming from [Nahuel Molina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nahuel_Molina "Nahuel Molina") and a penalty from Messi, but succumbed to two late goals by [Wout Weghorst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wout_Weghorst "Wout Weghorst") as regulation time ended 2–2 after 90 minutes; neither could find the breakthrough in extra time and penalties were used to decide the winner. Emiliano Martínez saved the first two Dutch penalties from [Virgil van Dijk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van Dijk") and [Steven Berghuis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Berghuis "Steven Berghuis"), while only Fernández missed for Argentina as [Lautaro Martínez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lautaro_Mart%C3%ADnez "Lautaro Martínez") scored the decisive last kick of the game, a result reminiscent of their 2014 most recent, also [knockout stage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Netherlands_vs_Argentina "2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") meeting and sending them through the semi-finals, as they meet 2018 runners up [Croatia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team").[[49]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-49)[[50]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-50) In a rematch of the [2018 encounter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D#Argentina_vs_Croatia "2018 FIFA World Cup Group D") when Croatia had won 3–0, Argentina decisively beat Croatia by the same scoreline. Lionel Messi scored a first-half penalty before Alvarez scored a solo effort five minutes later. Messi then assisted Alvarez for his double in the second half, as Argentina booked their place in the final for the second time in eight years.[[51]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-51)\n\n### France\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: France")]\n\nFrance\'s route to the final |  | Opponent | Result |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| 1 | ![Image 16](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png)[Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national soccer team") | [4–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D#France_vs_Australia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D") |\n| 2 | ![Image 17](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/Flag_of_Denmark.svg/20px-Flag_of_Denmark.svg.png)[Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denmark_national_football_team "Denmark national football team") | [2–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D#France_vs_Denmark "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D") |\n| 3 | ![Image 18](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png)[Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia_national_football_team "Tunisia national football team") | [0–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D#Tunisia_vs_France "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D") |\n| R16 | ![Image 19](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/40px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png)[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team "Poland national football team") | [3–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#France_vs_Poland "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") |\n| QF | ![Image 20](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/40px-Flag_of_England.svg.png)[England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") | [2–1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#England_vs_France "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") |\n| SF | ![Image 21](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Flag_of_Morocco.svg/40px-Flag_of_Morocco.svg.png)[Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") | [2–0](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#France_vs_Morocco "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") |\n\nFrance started their World Cup campaign as the defending world champions, having won the most recent tournament in Russia, and was drawn in group D. Their first meeting was against [AFC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asian_Football_Confederation "Asian Football Confederation") representative Australia. The French suffered a shock deficit after nine minutes due to a goal by [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin"), but were able to stage a comeback with a double from [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") together with goals from [Adrien Rabiot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrien_Rabiot "Adrien Rabiot") and Kylian Mbappé to win 4–1.[[52]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-52) Empowered by the win, France overcame a highly organised and threatening [Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denmark_national_football_team "Denmark national football team") side with Mbappé striking twice in the second half, despite conceding an equaliser from [Andreas Christensen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andreas_Christensen "Andreas Christensen"). France won 2–1 and became the first team to progress to the knockout stage of the World Cup in Qatar and the first European world champions to do so since [1994](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1994_FIFA_World_Cup "1994 FIFA World Cup").[[53]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-53) With progression assured, France rotated most of their team, resting their key players for the final game against a desperate [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia_national_football_team "Tunisia national football team"); France resultantly lost 1–0 courtesy of a goal by French-born [Wahbi Khazri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wahbi_Khazri "Wahbi Khazri") before having an equaliser by Antoine Griezmann disallowed. France maintained top of the group due to a superior goal difference over Australia.[[54]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-54)\n\nIn the round of 16, France overcame group C runners-up [Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team "Poland national football team") 3–1 with goals from Giroud and Mbappé, despite conceding a late penalty from [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski").[[55]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-55) The quarter-finals saw France battling old rivals [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") in a tense match, with France defeating England 2–1 with goals from [Aurélien Tchouaméni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lien_Tchouam%C3%A9ni "Aurélien Tchouaméni") and Giroud; England found an equaliser for 1–1 courtesy of a penalty by [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane") but a second penalty to equalise the game was missed by Kane, granting France a place in the semi-finals.[[56]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-56) France then faced the biggest underdog of the tournament, [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team"), who had beaten both [Iberian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iberian_Peninsula "Iberian Peninsula") representatives [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team "Spain national football team") and [Portugal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team "Portugal national football team") in the process; the French were able to end the history-making run by the African nation with two goals from [Théo Hernandez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") and [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") for a 2–0 result. France reached their second consecutive World Cup final for the first time in their history.[[57]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-57)\n\nPre-match\n---------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=6 "Edit section: Pre-match")]\n\n[![Image 22](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/SzymonMarciniakReferee.jpg/250px-SzymonMarciniakReferee.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:SzymonMarciniakReferee.jpg)\n\n[Szymon Marciniak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szymon_Marciniak "Szymon Marciniak") officiated the final.\n\nPolish referee [Szymon Marciniak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szymon_Marciniak "Szymon Marciniak") was named as the referee of the final on 15 December 2022, with fellow Poles Paweł Sokolnicki and Tomasz Listkiewicz appointed as assistant referees.[[58]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials1-58)[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials2-59) Marciniak became a [FIFA referee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_referee "FIFA referee") in 2011[[60]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-60) and had previously served as a referee at the UEFA Euro 2016 and 2018 FIFA World Cup, as well as during the [2018 UEFA Super Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_UEFA_Super_Cup "2018 UEFA Super Cup").[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials2-59) Earlier in the tournament, Marciniak officiated the France–Denmark group stage game, as well as the Argentina–Australia match in the round of 16. It was the first time that a Polish referee led the team of officials at a World Cup final, and the second time that a Polish referee was included among the officials during such a match, after [Michał Listkiewicz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Micha%C5%82_Listkiewicz "Michał Listkiewicz") (father of Marciniak\'s assistant Tomasz) served as a linesman during the 1990 FIFA World Cup final.[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials2-59)\n\n[![Image 23](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Lalii_en_2017.png/150px-Lalii_en_2017.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lalii_en_2017.png)\n\n[![Image 24](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Farrah_El-Dibany_cropped.jpg/250px-Farrah_El-Dibany_cropped.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Farrah_El-Dibany_cropped.jpg)\n\nPrior to the match, [Lali Espósito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lali_Esp%C3%B3sito "Lali Espósito") (left) and [Farrah Eldibany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farrah_Eldibany "Farrah Eldibany") sang the Argentine and French national anthems, respectively.\n\n[Ismail Elfath](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ismail_Elfath "Ismail Elfath") and Kathryn Nesbitt of the United States were appointed as fourth official and reserve assistant referee, respectively,[[61]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-SA-61) while another Pole, Tomasz Kwiatkowski, led the video assistant referee team.[[58]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials1-58) Venezuelan [Juan Soto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Soto_(referee) "Juan Soto (referee)") served as assistant video assistant referee, American Kyle Atkins was the offside video assistant referee, and the role of support video assistant referee was assigned to Mexican [Fernando Guerrero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fernando_Guerrero_(referee) "Fernando Guerrero (referee)").[[58]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-officials1-58) German [Bastian Dankert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Dankert "Bastian Dankert") and American Corey Parker served as stand-by video assistant referee and stand-by assistant video assistant referee, respectively.[[62]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-62)[[61]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-SA-61)\n\nSeveral heads of state were in attendance, among them Qatari Emir [Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamim_bin_Hamad_Al_Thani "Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani"), Turkish president [Recep Tayyip Erdoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan "Recep Tayyip Erdoğan"), and French president [Emmanuel Macron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron "Emmanuel Macron"). Various members of the [FIFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA "FIFA") Council and FIFA president [Gianni Infantino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gianni_Infantino "Gianni Infantino") were also in attendance.[[63]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-63) Argentine head of state [Alberto Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberto_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Alberto Fernández") did not attend after having reportedly refused to travel to Qatar due to potential political backlash.[[64]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-64)[[65]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-65) However, [Claudio Tapia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claudio_Tapia "Claudio Tapia"), the president of the [Argentine Football Association](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association "Argentine Football Association") was present in the final.[[66]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-66)\n\nThe tournament\'s closing ceremony was held prior to the start of the match; it featured a collaboration between Puerto Rican singer [Ozuna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozuna "Ozuna") and French singer [Gims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gims "Gims"). Also performing were [Nora Fatehi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nora_Fatehi "Nora Fatehi"), [Balqees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balqees_(singer) "Balqees (singer)"), [Rahma Riad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rahma_Riad "Rahma Riad") and [Manal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manal_(singer) "Manal (singer)").[[67]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-67)\n\nThe winners trophy was unveiled by World Cup winning captain [Iker Casillas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iker_Casillas "Iker Casillas") and Indian actress [Deepika Padukone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deepika_Padukone "Deepika Padukone").[[68]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-68)\n\nArgentine singer [Lali Espósito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lali_Esp%C3%B3sito "Lali Espósito") sang the "[Argentine National Anthem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_National_Anthem "Argentine National Anthem")"[[69]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-69) and Egyptian mezzo-soprano [Farrah Eldibany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farrah_Eldibany "Farrah Eldibany") sang the French national anthem, "[La Marseillaise](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Marseillaise "La Marseillaise")", before the match.[[70]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-70)\n\nMatch\n-----\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=7 "Edit section: Match")]\n\n### Summary\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: Summary")]\n\n#### First half\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: First half")]\n\n[![Image 25](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg/250px-Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)\n\n[![Image 26](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_(7)_(cropped).jpg)\n\nArgentina captain and forward [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") (left) was named [man of the match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Player_of_the_match#Association_football "Player of the match"). France forward [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") (right) became the second player in history to score a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick#Association_football "Hat-trick") in a World Cup final.\n\nFrance kicked off the match at 18:00 [local time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabia_Standard_Time "Arabia Standard Time") (15:00 [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTC%2B00:00 "UTC+00:00")) in front of a crowd of 88,966.[[71]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-71) Argentina were awarded a penalty in the 23rd minute when Ángel Di María was fouled in the penalty area by [Ousmane Dembélé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ousmane_Demb%C3%A9l%C3%A9 "Ousmane Dembélé") as Di María cut in from the left. Lionel Messi scored the penalty with a low shot to the right corner. In the 36th minute, Di Maria finished a sweeping Argentina counter-attack to make it 2–0, shooting with his left foot over the goalkeeper to the right corner of the net after a pass from Alexis Mac Allister from the right.[[72]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-72) France made two early substitutions near the end of the first half and went into half-time trailing 0–2.[[73]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-NBCNews-73)\n\n#### Second half\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: Second half")]\n\nArgentina were on course for the win, controlling possession, and defensively shutting down France, who failed to make an attempt on goal until the 80th minute, at which point France was awarded a penalty after Randal Kolo Muani was brought down in the penalty area by [Nicolás Otamendi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Otamendi "Nicolás Otamendi"). Kylian Mbappé scored the penalty low to the left corner, despite Emiliano Martínez getting a hand on the ball, making the game 2–1. 97 seconds later, [Kingsley Coman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingsley_Coman "Kingsley Coman") tackled Messi right as the game restarted, starting a rapid counter-attack which finished with Mbappé first-time volleying a lofted pass from [Marcus Thuram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcus_Thuram "Marcus Thuram") with his right foot as he was falling to the ground to the bottom-right corner of the net to make the game 2–2; Martínez again attempted to parry the ball but couldn\'t keep it out.\n\nFive minutes after Mbappé\'s equalizer, Thuram went down in the penalty box after slightly tripping on Enzo Fernández\'s leg, only to be booked for [diving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diving_(association_football) "Diving (association football)"). Both teams came close to finishing the game near the end of added time as Adrien Rabiot fired a quick shot inside the box, forcing a fumbling save from Emiliano Martínez; then three minutes later Messi had a hard shot parried over the bar by [Hugo Lloris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugo_Lloris "Hugo Lloris"). With the score tied at the end of regulation time, the match went to extra time.[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Argentina_3_France_3_4%E2%80%932_on_pens-74)\n\n#### Extra time\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: Extra time")]\n\nAfter first half of extra time finished goalless, notably highlighted by two [one-on-one](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_association_football_terms#O "Glossary of association football terms") opportunities missed by Lautaro Martínez,[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Argentina_3_France_3_4%E2%80%932_on_pens-74) Messi scored again for Argentina in the second period of extra time when he finished from close range after Lloris had parried a shot from Lautaro Martínez on the right, in what seemed to be the winning goal. However, France was awarded a second penalty in the 118th minute after a shot by Mbappé hit the arm of [Gonzalo Montiel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gonzalo_Montiel "Gonzalo Montiel").[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Argentina_3_France_3_4%E2%80%932_on_pens-74) Mbappé scored his third goal with his penalty kick to the left, sending Martínez the wrong way and becoming the second player to score a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") in a men\'s World Cup final after [Geoff Hurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Hurst "Geoff Hurst") for England in [1966](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup_final "1966 FIFA World Cup final").[[73]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-NBCNews-73)\n\nIn the 123rd minute, with 15 seconds of the extra time to spare, a loose ball fell to an unmarked Kolo Muani at the edge of the box, who shot low to the right of the goal; however, Emiliano Martínez blocked the shot with his left shin. Argentina counter-attacked immediately, ending with Lautaro Martínez heading wide of the goal from 10 yards.[[73]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-NBCNews-73) France produced one last attack when Mbappé dribbled in the penalty box, passing three Argentina defenders, only for [Paulo Dybala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paulo_Dybala "Paulo Dybala") to make a timely clearance off the field.[[75]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-75) The referee then blew the final whistle of extra time and the match went to a penalty shoot-out.\n\n#### Penalty shoot-out\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: Penalty shoot-out")]\n\n[![Image 27](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez_vs_Colombia%2C_1-2-2022.jpg/330px-Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez_vs_Colombia%2C_1-2-2022.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez_vs_Colombia,_1-2-2022.jpg)\n\nArgentina goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez made two key saves during the last minute of extra time and the decisive penalty shoot-out\n\nFor the third time in history, the World Cup final would be decided on penalties. Mbappé and Messi successfully converted the first two attempts to begin the penalty shootout at 1–1. Argentina goalkeeper Martínez would continue to use the psychological tactics and means of [gamesmanship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamesmanship#Association_football "Gamesmanship") that he utilized during the [penalty shoot-outs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Lusail#Penalty_shoot-out "Battle of Lusail") in the quarter-final against the Netherlands. After delaying Kingsley Coman\'s attempt by arguing with the referee, Martínez then saved Coman\'s shot, which was down low to Martínez\'s right.[[76]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Mukhopadhyay2023-76) Dybala sent a shot into the net up the middle to give Argentina a 2–1 lead.\n\nBefore Aurélien Tchouaméni\'s shot, Martínez picked up the ball and then threw it to the edge of the box. Tchouaméni then sent his shot wide of the goal to the left.[[76]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Mukhopadhyay2023-76)[Leandro Paredes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leandro_Paredes "Leandro Paredes") then scored to put France on the brink of defeat at 3–1. Kolo Muani kept France alive by scoring his chance and reducing France\'s deficit to 3–2; Martínez attempted to use his psychological tactics on Kolo Muani but was instead shown a yellow card.[[77]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-77) Montiel was then given a chance to make up for his late handball by clinching the championship for Argentina. Montiel scored low to the left, securing the 4–2 penalty shoot-out victory for Argentina and giving them their third World Cup trophy and first since 1986.[[78]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-78)\n\n### Details\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=13 "Edit section: Details")]\n\n18 December 2022(2022-12-18)\n\n18:00 [AST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabia_Standard_Time "Arabia Standard Time")\n\n| RW | **11** | [Ousmane Dembélé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ousmane_Demb%C3%A9l%C3%A9 "Ousmane Dembélé") |  | ![Image 84: downward-facing red Fofana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssouf_Fofana_(French_footballer) "Youssouf Fofana (French footballer)") |  | ![Image 93: upward-facing green ![Image 95: upward-facing green arrow](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Sub_on.svg/20px-Sub_on.svg.png)120+1\' |\n| **Manager:** |\n| [Didier Deschamps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didier_Deschamps "Didier Deschamps") |\n\n**Man of the Match:**\n\nLionel Messi (Argentina)[[81]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-MOTM-82)\n\n**[Assistant referees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assistant_referee_(association_football) "Assistant referee (association football)"):**\n\nPaweł Sokolnicki ([Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_Football_Association "Polish Football Association")) \n\nTomasz Listkiewicz (Poland) \n\n**[Fourth official](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assistant_referee_(association_football)#Fourth_official "Assistant referee (association football)"):**\n\nIsmail Elfath ([United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Soccer_Federation "United States Soccer Federation")) \n\n**[Reserve assistant referee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assistant_referee_(association_football)#Reserve_assistant_referee "Assistant referee (association football)"):**\n\nKathryn Nesbitt (United States) \n\n**[Video assistant referee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_assistant_referee "Video assistant referee"):**\n\nTomasz Kwiatkowski (Poland)**Match rules**[[82]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-regulations-83)\n\n*   90 minutes\n*   30 minutes of [extra time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football "Overtime (sports)") if necessary\n*   [Penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") if scores still level\n*   Maximum of fifteen named substitutes\n*   Maximum of five substitutions, with a sixth allowed in extra time[[note 2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-84)\n*   Maximum of one [concussion substitution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Concussion_substitute_(association_football) "Concussion substitute (association football)")\n\n### Statistics\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=14 "Edit section: Statistics")]\n\nFirst half[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Sofascore-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-AS-86)| Statistic | Argentina | France |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| Goals scored | 2 | 0 |\n| Total shots | 6 | 0 |\n| Shots on target | 3 | 0 |\n| Saves | 0 | 1 |\n| Ball possession | 59% | 41% |\n| Corner kicks | 2 | 0 |\n| Fouls committed | 10 | 11 |\n| Offsides | 3 | 0 |\n| Yellow cards | 1 | 0 |\n| Red cards | 0 | 0 |\n\nSecond half[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Sofascore-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-AS-86)| Statistic | Argentina | France |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| Goals scored | 0 | 2 |\n| Total shots | 6 | 6 |\n| Shots on target | 4 | 3 |\n| Saves | 1 | 4 |\n| Ball possession | 45% | 55% |\n| Corner kicks | 2 | 3 |\n| Fouls committed | 9 | 5 |\n| Offsides | 0 | 2 |\n| Yellow cards | 1 | 3 |\n| Red cards | 0 | 0 |\n\nExtra time[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Sofascore-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-AS-86)| Statistic | Argentina | France |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| Goals scored | 1 | 1 |\n| Total shots | 8 | 4 |\n| Shots on target | 3 | 2 |\n| Saves | 1 | 2 |\n| Ball possession | 62% | 38% |\n| Corner kicks | 2 | 2 |\n| Fouls committed | 6 | 3 |\n| Offsides | 1 | 2 |\n| Yellow cards | 3 | 0 |\n| Red cards | 0 | 0 |\n\nOverall[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-Sofascore-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-AS-86)| Statistic | Argentina | France |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| Goals scored | 3 | 3 |\n| Total shots | 20 | 10 |\n| Shots on target | 10 | 5 |\n| Saves | 2 | 7 |\n| Ball possession | 54% | 46% |\n| Corner kicks | 6 | 5 |\n| Fouls committed | 26[[note 3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-87) | 19 |\n| Offsides | 4 | 4 |\n| Yellow cards | 5 | 3 |\n| Red cards | 0 | 0 |\n\nPost-match and legacy\n---------------------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=15 "Edit section: Post-match and legacy")]\n\n[![Image 96](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Fiesta_en_el_Obelisco.jpg/250px-Fiesta_en_el_Obelisco.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Fiesta_en_el_Obelisco.jpg)\n\n[![Image 97](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Festejos_en_el_Obelisco_de_Buenos_Aires_por_la_obtenci%C3%B3n_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_de_F%C3%BAtbol_2022.jpg/250px-Festejos_en_el_Obelisco_de_Buenos_Aires_por_la_obtenci%C3%B3n_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_de_F%C3%BAtbol_2022.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Festejos_en_el_Obelisco_de_Buenos_Aires_por_la_obtenci%C3%B3n_de_la_Copa_del_Mundo_de_F%C3%BAtbol_2022.jpg)\n\nCelebrations near the [Obelisco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obelisco_de_Buenos_Aires "Obelisco de Buenos Aires") (top) and all along [Avenida 9 de Julio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avenida_9_de_Julio "Avenida 9 de Julio") (bottom), in the Argentine capital [Buenos Aires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buenos_Aires "Buenos Aires"), after the World Cup coronation.\n\nPundits, commentators, and audiences praised the intensity, stressful atmosphere, and thrilling back-and-forth nature of the match, highlighting the number of goals scored, and with many media outlets spotlighting it as a duel between [Paris Saint-Germain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C. "Paris Saint-Germain F.C.") teammates Messi and Mbappé.[[85]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-88)[[86]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-89)[[87]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-90)[[88]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-91) The match has since been hailed as one of the most exciting [World Cup finals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIFA_World_Cup_finals "List of FIFA World Cup finals"), and among the greatest football matches ever.[[89]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-92)[[90]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-93)[[91]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-94)[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-95)\n\nWith the victory, Argentina won their third FIFA World Cup title to surpass France and [Uruguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team "Uruguay national football team"), their titles ranking behind only Brazil\'s five and the four of Italy and [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team "Germany national football team"). They became the first South American and first non-European side to win the World Cup since Brazil in 2002,[[93]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-RSSSF-96) and the first reigning champions of the Copa América to win the World Cup.[[94]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-97) Having won on penalties against the Netherlands in the quarter-finals, Argentina became the first team to have won on that method twice en route to the title.[[95]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-98) It was the tenth World Cup title for a South American side, and the eighth South American victory in eleven finals facing European opposition. France became the third defending champions to lose in the following final, after Argentina in 1990 and Brazil in 1998.[[96]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-99) The match was the third FIFA World Cup final to be decided by a penalty shoot-out, after [1994](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1994_FIFA_World_Cup_final "1994 FIFA World Cup final") and [2006](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2006 FIFA World Cup final"), the latter of which France lost to Italy.[[97]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-100) This meant that France had not won on penalties in all competitions since the [1998 World Cup quarter-final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Italy_vs_France "1998 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") against Italy. The six goals in the final brought the total number of goals in the tournament to a record 172, surpassing the 171 goals scored in 1998 and 2014.[[98]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-101)\n\nFIFA president Gianni Infantino was present on the pitch stage during the awards ceremony to hand out the medals and present the trophy to the Argentine captain Lionel Messi. He was joined by Qatari Emir Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, French president Emmanuel Macron, Argentine Football Association president Claudio Tapia, [French Football Federation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Football_Federation "French Football Federation") president [Noël Le Graët](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No%C3%ABl_Le_Gra%C3%ABt "Noël Le Graët"), [CONMEBOL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CONMEBOL "CONMEBOL") president [Alejandro Domínguez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alejandro_Dom%C3%ADnguez_(football_executive) "Alejandro Domínguez (football executive)") and [UEFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA "UEFA") president [Aleksander Čeferin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleksander_%C4%8Ceferin "Aleksander Čeferin").[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-102)[Sergio Batista](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergio_Batista "Sergio Batista") and [Nery Pumpido](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nery_Pumpido "Nery Pumpido"), World Cup winners with Argentina in 1986, brought the trophy onto the pitch for the ceremony.[[100]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-103) Before being presented with the trophy by the Emir and Infantino, Messi was given a [bisht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisht_(clothing) "Bisht (clothing)") to wear by the Emir prior to the trophy celebration. The trophy presentation had scenery unlike previous tournaments, with [confetti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confetti "Confetti") replaced by [pyrotechnics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyrotechnics "Pyrotechnics") and lights with a backdrop of some orchestral cinematic music.[[101]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-104)\n\nMessi was named as the [player of the match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Player_of_the_match "Player of the match")[[81]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-MOTM-82) and won his second [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup awards") award after 2014 as the best player of the tournament, becoming the first (and so far only) player to receive the award twice.[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-awards-105) He also won the [Silver Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup awards") award with the second-most goals at the tournament, seven.[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-top_goalscorers-106) Messi\'s appearance in the final, his 26th World Cup game, meant he surpassed [Lothar Matthäus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lothar_Matth%C3%A4us "Lothar Matthäus") as the player with the [most appearances in the World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_players_who_have_appeared_in_the_most_FIFA_World_Cups "List of players who have appeared in the most FIFA World Cups").[[104]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-107) With his goals, Messi became the second player to score in the round of 16, quarter-finals, semi-finals and final of a World Cup tournament, after Hungary\'s [György Sárosi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gy%C3%B6rgy_S%C3%A1rosi "György Sárosi") in 1938, and the only player to score in all of those knockout rounds as well as the group stage.[[105]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-108) Having scored once in the previous final, Mbappé\'s hat-trick made him the [highest-scoring player in the final of the World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIFA_World_Cup_final_goalscorers "List of FIFA World Cup final goalscorers") with four goals, surpassing the three of Hurst, Pelé, [Vavá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vav%C3%A1 "Vavá") and [Zinedine Zidane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane "Zinedine Zidane").[[106]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-109) In addition, with his three goals, he surpassed Messi to win the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards "FIFA World Cup awards") award as the top scorer of the tournament with eight goals,[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-top_goalscorers-106) the most in a World Cup since Brazil\'s [Ronaldo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer) "Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)") in 2002, and also was awarded the Silver Ball as the second-best player of the World Cup.[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-110) Argentina\'s Emiliano Martínez won the [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup awards") award as the best goalkeeper of the tournament, while his teammate Enzo Fernández won the [Young Player Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#FIFA_Young_Player_Award "FIFA World Cup awards") as the best player at the World Cup who is at most 21 (born on or after 1 January 2001).[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-awards-105)\n\nIn Argentina, celebrations erupted across the country, most notably in the capital [Buenos Aires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buenos_Aires "Buenos Aires") and in [Rosario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosario "Rosario"), Messi\'s hometown.[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-111) On 20 December, the celebration in the streets of Buenos Aires after the arrival of the players of Argentina gathered a crowd estimated by local media at over four million people, forcing the team to be airlifted by helicopter out of their bus.[[109]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-112) On 22 December, the French Football Federation confirmed to have lodged a formal complaint against the Argentine goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez for unsporting behaviour which included incidents such as a sarcastic prayer for silence for French forward Kylian Mbappé in the Argentine locker room after the match, as well as being seen holding and laughing at a toy with a facial cut of Mbappé\'s face stuck to it during the Argentine victory parade.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-113)[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-114) In France, [riots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_riot "Sports riot") erupted across the country in cities including Paris, [Lyon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyon "Lyon") and [Nice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nice "Nice");[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-115) these were very similar to those after [their victory in 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2018 FIFA World Cup final"), as well as after victories against [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#England_vs_France "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") and [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#France_vs_Morocco "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage") earlier in the tournament. Some French players like Kingsley Coman, Randal Kolo Muani and Aurélien Tchouaméni were racially abused online due to their performances by their own fans.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-116) Within 48 hours of Messi posting, the [Instagram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instagram "Instagram") post with the World Cup trophy had surpassed [75 million likes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-liked_Instagram_posts "List of most-liked Instagram posts"), and in doing so, it became the most-liked social media post ever across all social media platforms surpassing the previous most-liked Instagram post, the [world record egg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instagram_egg "Instagram egg").[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-117)[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-118)\n\nSee also\n--------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=16 "Edit section: See also")]\n\n*   [Argentina at the FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup "Argentina at the FIFA World Cup")\n*   [France at the FIFA World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup "France at the FIFA World Cup")\n\nNotes\n-----\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=17 "Edit section: Notes")]\n\n1.   ^ [_**a**_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-RabiotFofana_81-0)[_**b**_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-RabiotFofana_81-1)Rabiot suffered a knock to the head in the 94th minute. Therefore, his substitution for Fofana fell under FIFA\'s "concussion protocol", which allows a player at risk of a concussion to be substituted without taking account either the substitution window nor the amount of players already substituted.[[79]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-79)[[80]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_note-80)\n2.   **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-84)**Each team was given only three opportunities to make substitutions, with a fourth opportunity in extra time, excluding substitutions made at half-time, before the start of extra time and at half-time in extra time.\n3.   **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-87)**[Emiliano Martínez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") did not foul a French player, but received a yellow card foul due to [unsporting behaviour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsporting_behaviour "Unsporting behaviour") in the penalty shootout, which counts as a team foul.\n\nReferences\n----------\n\n[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final&action=edit&section=18 "Edit section: References")]\n\n1.   **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-1)**["FIFA World Cup – Final – Argentina v France"](https://www.fifa.com/fifaplus/en/match-centre/match/17/255711/285077/400128145). _FIFA.com_. Retrieved 18 December 2022.\n2.   **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final#cite_ref-2)**["Doha, Qatar Weather History"](https://www.wunderground.com/history/daily/qa/lusail/OTHH). "Нагороди ФІФА для найкращих 2022 – Ukrainian")\n* [中文](https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022%E5%B9%B4%E5%9C%8B%E9%9A%9B%E8%B6%B3%E7%B8%BD%E6%9C%80%E4%BD%B3%E8%B6%B3%E7%90%83%E7%8D%8E "2022年國際足總最佳足球獎 – Chinese")\n\n[Edit links](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityPage/Q116184477#sitelinks-wikipedia "Edit interlanguage links")\n\nFrom Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia\n\n[**Sorry to interrupt, but our fundraiser won\'t last long.**\nThis Saturday, we ask you to join the 2% of readers who give. If everyone reading this right now gave just $2.75, we\'d hit our goal quickly. $2.75 is all we ask.](#)\n\nSeptember 6: Knowledge is human.\n\nWe\'re sorry we\'ve asked you a few times recently, but it\'s Saturday, September 6—please don\'t wait until tomorrow to help. We\'re happy you consult Wikipedia often. If just 2% of our most loyal readers gave $2.75 today, we\'d reach our goal quickly. Most readers donate because Wikipedia is useful, others because they realize knowledge needs humans. If you agree, please give. Any contribution helps, whether it\'s $2.75 one time or monthly.\n\n25 years ago Wikipedia was a dream. A dream built piece by piece by people, not machines. Now, with 65 million articles and 260,000 volunteers across the world, Wikipedia is proof that knowledge is human—a place of free, collaborative, and accessible knowledge. Your donation isn\'t just supporting a website; it\'s investing in the world\'s largest collaborative project of human intelligence—crafted by humans, for humans. Please join the 2% of readers who give what they can to help keep Wikipedia strong and growing. Thank you.\n\nInternational football awards\n\n| The Best FIFA Football Awards 2022 | |\n| --- | --- |\n| [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi"), The Best FIFA Men\'s Player 2022 | |\n| |\n\n**The** **Best FIFA Football Awards 2022** were held on 27 February 2023 in Paris, France.[[2]](#cite_note-circular-1829-2)\n\n## Winners and nominees\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Winners and nominees")]\n\n### The Best FIFA Men\'s Player\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men\'s Player")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Men\'s Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Men\'s Player")\n\nFourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[3]](#cite_note-nominees-3) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[4]](#cite_note-4)\n\n[Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the award with 52 scoring points.[[5]](#cite_note-5)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[8]](#cite_note-8)\n\nThe selection criteria for the men\'s players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022.\n\n[Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé")\n\n[Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema")\n\n| Rank |
