"Liverpool F.C.") | [Egypt](/wiki/Egypt_national_football_team "Egypt national football team") | 2 |\n\n### The Best FIFA Men\'s Goalkeeper\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men\'s Goalkeeper")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Goalkeeper](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Goalkeeper "The Best FIFA Goalkeeper")\n\nFive players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[9]](#cite_note-9) The three finalists were revealed on 8 February 2023.[[10]](#cite_note-10)\n\n[Emiliano Martínez](/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") won the award with 26 ranking points.[[11]](#cite_note-11)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[12]](#cite_note-12)\n\n| Rank | Player | Club(s) played for | National team | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | |\n| 1 | [Emiliano Martínez](/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") | [Aston Villa](/wiki/Aston_Villa_F.C. "Manchester City F.C.") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team") | 4 |\n\n### The Best FIFA Men\'s Coach\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men\'s Coach")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Football Coach](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Coach "The Best FIFA Football Coach")\n\nFive coaches were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[13]](#cite_note-13) The three finalists were revealed on 9 February 2023.[[14]](#cite_note-14)\n\n[Lionel Scaloni](/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni "Lionel Scaloni") won the award with 28 scoring points.[[15]](#cite_note-15)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[16]](#cite_note-16)\n\n| Rank | Coach | Team(s) managed | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | |\n| 1 | [Lionel Scaloni](/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni "Lionel Scaloni") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") | 28 |\n| 2 | [Carlo Ancelotti](/wiki/Carlo_Ancelotti "Carlo Ancelotti") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | 17 |\n| 3 | [Pep Guardiola](/wiki/Pep_Guardiola "Pep Guardiola") | [Manchester City](/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C. Player\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women\'s Player")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Women\'s Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Women%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Women\'s Player")\n\nFourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[17]](#cite_note-17) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[18]](#cite_note-18)\n\n[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") won the award with 50 scoring points, her second consecutive win.[[19]](#cite_note-19)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[20]](#cite_note-20)\n\nThe selection criteria for the women\'s players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 7 August 2021 to 31 July 2022.\n\n[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas")\n\n[Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan")\n\n[Beth February 2023.[[26]](#cite_note-26)\n\n[Sarina Wiegman](/wiki/Sarina_Wiegman "Sarina Wiegman") won the award with 28 scoring points.[[27]](#cite_note-27)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[28]](#cite_note-28)\n\n| Rank | Coach | Team(s) managed | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | |\n| 1 | [Sarina Wiegman](/wiki/Sarina_Wiegman "Sarina Wiegman") | [England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women\'s national football team") | 28 |\n| 2 | [Sonia Bompastor](/wiki/Sonia_Bompastor "Sonia Bompastor") | [Lyon](/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais_F%C3%A9minin "Olympique Lyonnais Féminin") | 18 |\n| 3 | [Pia Sundhage](/wiki/Pia_Sundhage "Pia Sundhage") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_women%27s_national_football_team "Brazil women\'s national football team") | 10 |\n| Other candidates | | | | |\n| 4 | [Emma Hayes](/wiki/Emma_Hayes "Emma Hayes") | [Chelsea](/wiki/Chelsea_F.C._Women "Chelsea F.C. Women") | 10 |\n| 5 | [Martina Voss-Tecklenburg](/wiki/Martina_Voss-Tecklenburg "Martina Voss-Tecklenburg") | [Germany](/wiki/Germany_women%27s_national_football_team "Germany women\'s national football team") | 6 |\n| 6 | [Bev Priestman](/wiki/Bev_Priestman "Bev Priestman") | [Canada](/wiki/Canada_women%27s_national_soccer_team "Canada women\'s national soccer team") | 0 |\n\n### FIFA Puskás Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: FIFA Puskás Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Puskás Award](/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award "FIFA Puskás Award")\n\nThe eleven players initially shortlisted for the award were announced on 12 January 2023.[[29]](#cite_note-29) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[30]](#cite_note-30) All goals up for consideration were scored from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022. Every registered FIFA.com user was allowed to participate in the final vote until 3 February 2023, with the questionnaire being presented on the official website of FIFA. The selected goals were also voted on by a panel of "FIFA experts". Both groups\' votes weighed equally on the ultimate winner of the award.[[31]](#cite_note-31)\n\n[Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") won the award with 21 scoring points, becoming the first [amputee footballer](/wiki/Amputee_football "Amputee football") to earn the honour.[[32]](#cite_note-32)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)\n\n| Rank | Player | Match | Competition | Date | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | | |\n| 1 | [Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") | **[Warta Poznań](/wiki/Warta_Pozna%C5%84 "Warta Poznań")** – [Stal Rzeszów](/wiki/Stal_Rzesz%C3%B3w_(football) "Stal Rzeszów (football)") | 2022 PZU Amp Futbol Ekstraklasa | 6 November 2022 | 21 |\n| 2 | [Dimitri Payet](/wiki/Dimitri_Payet "Dimitri Payet") | **[Marseille](/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille "Olympique de Marseille")** – [PAOK](/wiki/PAOK_FC "PAOK FC") | [2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Europa_Conference_League "2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League") | 7 April 2022 | 20 |\n| 3 | [Richarlison](/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") | **[Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team")** – [Serbia](/wiki/Serbia_national_football_team "Serbia national football team") | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 24 November 2022 | 17 |\n| Other candidates | | | | | |\n| Unranked | [Mario Balotelli](/wiki/Mario_Balotelli "Mario Balotelli") | **[Adana Demirspor](/wiki/Adana_Demirspor "Adana Demirspor")** – [Göztepe](/wiki/G%C3%B6ztepe_S.K. "Göztepe S.K.") | [2021–22 Süper Lig](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_S%C3%BCper_Lig "2021–22 Süper Lig") | 22 May 2022 | N/A |\n| [Francisco González Metilli](/wiki/Francisco_Gonz%C3%A1lez_Metilli "Francisco González Metilli") | [Rosario Central](/wiki/Rosario_Central "Rosario Central") – **[Central Córdoba](/wiki/Central_C%C3%B3rdoba_de_Santiago_del_Estero "Central Córdoba de Santiago del Estero")** | [2022 Argentine Primera División](/wiki/2022_Argentine_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n "2022 Argentine Primera División") | 1 August 2022 |\n| [Amandine Henry](/wiki/Amandine_Henry "Amandine Henry") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Lyon](/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais_F%C3%A9minin "Olympique Lyonnais Féminin")** | [2021–22 UEFA Women\'s Champions League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Women%27s_Champions_League "2021–22 UEFA Women\'s Champions League") | 21 May 2022 |\n| [Théo Hernandez](/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") | **[Milan](/wiki/A.C._Milan "A.C. Milan")** – [Atalanta](/wiki/Atalanta_B.C. "Atalanta B.C.") | [2021–22 Serie A](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Serie_A "2021–22 Serie A") | 15 May 2022 |\n| [Alou Kuol](/wiki/Alou_Kuol "Alou Kuol") | [Iraq](/wiki/Iraq_national_under-23_football_team "Iraq national under-23 football team") – **[Australia](/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_under-23_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national under-23 soccer team")** | [2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup](/wiki/2022_AFC_U-23_Asian_Cup "2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup") | 4 June 2022 |\n| [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") – **[France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")** | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 18 December 2022 |\n| [Salma Paralluelo](/wiki/Salma_Paralluelo "Salma Paralluelo") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Villarreal](/wiki/Villarreal_CF_(women) "Villarreal CF (women)")** | [2021–22 Primera División (women)](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n_(women) "2021–22 Primera División (women)") | 2 April 2022 |\n| [Alessia Russo](/wiki/Alessia_Russo "Alessia Russo") | **[England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women\'s national football team")** – [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden_women%27s_national_football_team "Sweden women\'s national football team") | [UEFA Women\'s Euro 2022](/wiki/UEFA_Women%27s_Euro_2022 "UEFA Women\'s Euro 2022") | 26 July 2022 |\n\n### FIFA Fan Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: FIFA Fan Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Fan Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fan_Award "FIFA Fan Award")\n\nThe award celebrates the best fan moments or gestures of August 2021 to December 2022, regardless of championship, gender or nationality. The shortlist was compiled by a panel of FIFA experts.[[33]](#cite_note-33)\n\n[Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans won the award with over 650,000 registered votes.[[34]](#cite_note-34)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)\n\n| Rank | Fan(s) | Reason | Votes | % of total votes |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| Nominees | | | | |\n| 1 | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans | Their support in travelling to Qatar to support their teams eventual winning run at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"), and followed by the millions of fans welcoming the team home to [Buenos Aires](/wiki/Buenos_Aires "Buenos Aires") following their tournament win. | 656,253 | 41.88% |\n| 2 | [Japan](/wiki/Japan_national_football_team "Japan national football team") fans | Traditional nature of staying behind following their nation’s games at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") to clean up the stadium. | 526,887 | 33.63% |\n| 3 | Abdullah Al Salmi | Hiking 1,600 km across the Arabian desert from [Jeddah](/wiki/Jeddah "Jeddah") to Qatar to support his home nation at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"). | 383,643 | 24.49% |\n\n### FIFA Fair Play Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: FIFA Fair Play Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Fair Play Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fair_Play_Award "FIFA Fair Play Award")\n\n| Winner | Team | Reason |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| [Luka Lochoshvili](/wiki/Luka_Lochoshvili "Luka Lochoshvili") | [Wolfsberger AC](/wiki/Wolfsberger_AC "Wolfsberger AC") | Saved [Georg Teigl](/wiki/Georg_Teigl "Georg Teigl")\'s life, clearing the defender’s airways after he swallowed his tongue. Thanks to Lochoshvili\'s actions, Teigl regained consciousness and then was treated at a local hospital.[[35]](#cite_note-:0-35) |\n\n### The Best FIFA Special Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Special Award")]\n\nAn additional award was given out posthumously in tribute to the late [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé"), to recognize his role and contribution to the sport of football. The award was received by Pelé\'s wife Marcia Aoki.[[36]](#cite_note-36)\n\n| Winner | Reason |\n| --- | --- |\n| [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé") | Posthumously awarded as a tribute and special recognition for his role in football. |\n\n### FIFA FIFPRO Men\'s World 11\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Men\'s World 11")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")\n\nThe 26–player men\'s shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[37]](#cite_note-37)\n\nThe players chosen were [Thibaut Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois") as goalkeeper, [Achraf Hakimi](/wiki/Achraf_Hakimi "Achraf Hakimi"), [Virgil van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van Dijk") and [João Cancelo](/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Cancelo "João Cancelo") as defenders, [Kevin De Bruyne](/wiki/Kevin_De_Bruyne "Kevin De Bruyne"), [Casemiro](/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") and [Luka Modrić](/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić") as midfielders, and [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi"), [Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema"), [Erling Haaland](/wiki/Erling_Haaland "Erling Haaland") and [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") as forwards.[[38]](#cite_note-38)[[39]](#cite_note-39)\n\n**[Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois")**\n\n**[Van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van "Manchester United F.C.") * [Al Nassr](/wiki/Al_Nassr_FC "Al Nassr FC") |\n\n### FIFA FIFPRO Women\'s World 11\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=13 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Women\'s World 11")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")\n\nThe 23–player women\'s shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[40]](#cite_note-40)\n\nThe players chosen were [Christiane Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler") as goalkeeper, [Lucy Bronze](/wiki/Lucy_Bronze "Lucy Bronze"), [Mapi León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León"), [Wendie Renard](/wiki/Wendie_Renard "Wendie Renard") and [Leah Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Leah Williamson") as defenders, [Lena Oberdorf](/wiki/Lena_Oberdorf "Lena Oberdorf"), [Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") and [Keira Walsh](/wiki/Keira_Walsh "Keira Walsh") as midfielders, and [Sam Kerr](/wiki/Sam_Kerr "Sam Kerr"), [Beth Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead") and [Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan") as forwards.[[41]](#cite_note-41)[[42]](#cite_note-42)\n\n**[Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler")**\n\n**[León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León")**\n\n**[Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Manchester City W.F.C.") |\n\n## References\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=14 "Edit section: References")]\n\n1. **[^](#cite_ref-1 "Jump up")** ["The Best Fifa Football Awards: Messi and Putellas win top player prizes – as it happened"](https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2023/feb/27/the-best-fifa-football-awards-live). *The Guardian*. 27 February 2023. but our fundraiser won\'t last long.**\nThis Saturday, we ask you to join the 2% of readers who give. If everyone reading this right now gave just $2.75, we\'d hit our goal quickly. $2.75 is all we ask.](#)\n\nSeptember 6: Knowledge is human.\n\nWe\'re sorry we\'ve asked you a few times recently, but it\'s Saturday, September 6—please don\'t wait until tomorrow to help. We\'re happy you consult Wikipedia often. If just 2% of our most loyal readers gave $2.75 today, we\'d reach our goal quickly. Most readers donate because Wikipedia is useful, others because they realize knowledge needs humans. If you agree, please give. Any contribution helps, whether it\'s $2.75 one time or monthly.\n\n25 years ago Wikipedia was a dream. A dream built piece by piece by people, not machines. Now, with 65 million articles and 260,000 volunteers across the world, Wikipedia is proof that knowledge is human—a place of free, collaborative, and accessible knowledge. Your donation isn\'t just supporting a website; it\'s investing in the world\'s largest collaborative project of human intelligence—crafted by humans, for humans. Please join the 2% of readers who give what they can to help keep Wikipedia strong and growing. Thank you.\n\nInternational football awards\n\n| The Best FIFA Football Awards 2022 | |\n| --- | --- |\n| [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi"), The Best FIFA Men\'s Player 2022 | |\n| |\n\n**The** **Best FIFA Football Awards 2022** were held on 27 February 2023 in Paris, France.[[2]](#cite_note-circular-1829-2)\n\n## Winners and nominees\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Winners and nominees")]\n\n### The Best FIFA Men\'s Player\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men\'s Player")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Men\'s Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Men\'s Player")\n\nFourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[3]](#cite_note-nominees-3) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[4]](#cite_note-4)\n\n[Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the award with 52 scoring points.[[5]](#cite_note-5)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[8]](#cite_note-8)\n\nThe selection criteria for the men\'s players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022.\n\n[Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé")\n\n[Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema")\n\n| Rank | Player\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women\'s Player")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Women\'s Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Women%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Women\'s Player")\n\nFourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[17]](#cite_note-17) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[18]](#cite_note-18)\n\n[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") won the award with 50 scoring points, her second consecutive win.[[19]](#cite_note-19)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[20]](#cite_note-20)\n\nThe selection criteria for the women\'s players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 7 August 2021 to 31 July 2022.\n\n[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas")\n\n[Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan")\n\n[Beth Women") | [Canada](/wiki/Canada_women%27s_national_soccer_team "Canada women\'s national soccer team") | 0 |\n\n### The Best FIFA Women\'s Goalkeeper\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=6 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women\'s Goalkeeper")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Goalkeeper](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Goalkeeper "The Best FIFA Goalkeeper")\n\nSix players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[21]](#cite_note-21) The three finalists were revealed on 8 February 2023.[[22]](#cite_note-22)\n\n[Mary Earps](/wiki/Mary_Earps "Mary Earps") won the award with 26 scoring points.[[23]](#cite_note-23)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[24]](#cite_note-24)\n\n| Rank | Player | Club(s) played for | National team | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | |\n| 1 | [Mary Earps](/wiki/Mary_Earps "Mary Earps") | [Manchester United](/wiki/Manchester_United_W.F.C. Women\'s Coach\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=7 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women\'s Coach")]\n\nSee also: [The Best FIFA Football Coach](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Coach "The Best FIFA Football Coach")\n\nSix coaches were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[25]](#cite_note-25) The three finalists were revealed on 9 February 2023.[[26]](#cite_note-26)\n\n[Sarina Wiegman](/wiki/Sarina_Wiegman "Sarina Wiegman") won the award with 28 scoring points.[[27]](#cite_note-27)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[28]](#cite_note-28)\n\n| Rank | Coach | Team(s) managed | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | |\n| 1 | [Sarina Wiegman](/wiki/Sarina_Wiegman "Sarina Wiegman") | [England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women\'s national football team") | 28 |\n| 2 | [Sonia Bompastor](/wiki/Sonia_Bompastor "Sonia Bompastor") | [Lyon](/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais_F%C3%A9minin "Olympique Lyonnais Féminin") | 18 |\n| 3 | [Pia Sundhage](/wiki/Pia_Sundhage "Pia Sundhage") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_women%27s_national_football_team "Brazil women\'s national football team") | 10 |\n| Other candidates | | | | |\n| 4 | [Emma Hayes](/wiki/Emma_Hayes "Emma Hayes") | [Chelsea](/wiki/Chelsea_F.C._Women "Chelsea F.C. Women") | 10 |\n| 5 | [Martina Voss-Tecklenburg](/wiki/Martina_Voss-Tecklenburg "Martina Voss-Tecklenburg") | [Germany](/wiki/Germany_women%27s_national_football_team "Germany women\'s national football team") | 6 |\n| 6 | [Bev Priestman](/wiki/Bev_Priestman "Bev Priestman") | [Canada](/wiki/Canada_women%27s_national_soccer_team "Canada women\'s national soccer team") | 0 |\n\n### FIFA Puskás Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: FIFA Puskás Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Puskás Award](/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award "FIFA Puskás Award")\n\nThe eleven players initially shortlisted for the award were announced on 12 January 2023.[[29]](#cite_note-29) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[30]](#cite_note-30) All goals up for consideration were scored from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022. Every registered FIFA.com user was allowed to participate in the final vote until 3 February 2023, with the questionnaire being presented on the official website of FIFA. The selected goals were also voted on by a panel of "FIFA experts". Both groups\' votes weighed equally on the ultimate winner of the award.[[31]](#cite_note-31)\n\n[Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") won the award with 21 scoring points, becoming the first [amputee footballer](/wiki/Amputee_football "Amputee football") to earn the honour.[[32]](#cite_note-32)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)\n\n| Rank | Player | Match | Competition | Date | Points |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| The finalists | | | | | |\n| 1 | [Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") | **[Warta Poznań](/wiki/Warta_Pozna%C5%84 "Warta Poznań")** – [Stal Rzeszów](/wiki/Stal_Rzesz%C3%B3w_(football) "Stal Rzeszów (football)") | 2022 PZU Amp Futbol Ekstraklasa | 6 November 2022 | 21 |\n| 2 | [Dimitri Payet](/wiki/Dimitri_Payet "Dimitri Payet") | **[Marseille](/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille "Olympique de Marseille")** – [PAOK](/wiki/PAOK_FC "PAOK FC") | [2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Europa_Conference_League "2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League") | 7 April 2022 | 20 |\n| 3 | [Richarlison](/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") | **[Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team")** – [Serbia](/wiki/Serbia_national_football_team "Serbia national football team") | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 24 November 2022 | 17 |\n| Other candidates | | | | | |\n| Unranked | [Mario Balotelli](/wiki/Mario_Balotelli "Mario Balotelli") | **[Adana Demirspor](/wiki/Adana_Demirspor "Adana Demirspor")** – [Göztepe](/wiki/G%C3%B6ztepe_S.K. "Göztepe S.K.") | [2021–22 Süper Lig](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_S%C3%BCper_Lig "2021–22 Süper Lig") | 22 May 2022 | N/A |\n| [Francisco González Metilli](/wiki/Francisco_Gonz%C3%A1lez_Metilli "Francisco González Metilli") | [Rosario Central](/wiki/Rosario_Central "Rosario Central") – **[Central Córdoba](/wiki/Central_C%C3%B3rdoba_de_Santiago_del_Estero "Central Córdoba de Santiago del Estero")** | [2022 Argentine Primera División](/wiki/2022_Argentine_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n "2022 Argentine Primera División") | 1 August 2022 |\n| [Amandine Henry](/wiki/Amandine_Henry "Amandine Henry") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Lyon](/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais_F%C3%A9minin "Olympique Lyonnais Féminin")** | [2021–22 UEFA Women\'s Champions League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Women%27s_Champions_League "2021–22 UEFA Women\'s Champions League") | 21 May 2022 |\n| [Théo Hernandez](/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") | **[Milan](/wiki/A.C._Milan "A.C. Milan")** – [Atalanta](/wiki/Atalanta_B.C. "Atalanta B.C.") | [2021–22 Serie A](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Serie_A "2021–22 Serie A") | 15 May 2022 |\n| [Alou Kuol](/wiki/Alou_Kuol "Alou Kuol") | [Iraq](/wiki/Iraq_national_under-23_football_team "Iraq national under-23 football team") – **[Australia](/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_under-23_soccer_team "Australia men\'s national under-23 soccer team")** | [2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup](/wiki/2022_AFC_U-23_Asian_Cup "2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup") | 4 June 2022 |\n| [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") – **[France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")** | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 18 December 2022 |\n| [Salma Paralluelo](/wiki/Salma_Paralluelo "Salma Paralluelo") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Villarreal](/wiki/Villarreal_CF_(women) "Villarreal CF (women)")** | [2021–22 Primera División (women)](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n_(women) "2021–22 Primera División (women)") | 2 April 2022 |\n| [Alessia Russo](/wiki/Alessia_Russo "Alessia Russo") | **[England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women\'s national football team")** – [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden_women%27s_national_football_team "Sweden women\'s national football team") | [UEFA Women\'s Euro 2022](/wiki/UEFA_Women%27s_Euro_2022 "UEFA Women\'s Euro 2022") | 26 July 2022 |\n\n### FIFA Fan Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: FIFA Fan Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Fan Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fan_Award "FIFA Fan Award")\n\nThe award celebrates the best fan moments or gestures of August 2021 to December 2022, regardless of championship, gender or nationality. The shortlist was compiled by a panel of FIFA experts.[[33]](#cite_note-33)\n\n[Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans won the award with over 650,000 registered votes.[[34]](#cite_note-34)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)\n\n| Rank | Fan(s) | Reason | Votes | % of total votes |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| Nominees | | | | |\n| 1 | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans | Their support in travelling to Qatar to support their teams eventual winning run at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"), and followed by the millions of fans welcoming the team home to [Buenos Aires](/wiki/Buenos_Aires "Buenos Aires") following their tournament win. | 656,253 | 41.88% |\n| 2 | [Japan](/wiki/Japan_national_football_team "Japan national football team") fans | Traditional nature of staying behind following their nation’s games at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") to clean up the stadium. | 526,887 | 33.63% |\n| 3 | Abdullah Al Salmi | Hiking 1,600 km across the Arabian desert from [Jeddah](/wiki/Jeddah "Jeddah") to Qatar to support his home nation at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"). | 383,643 | 24.49% |\n\n### FIFA Fair Play Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: FIFA Fair Play Award")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA Fair Play Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fair_Play_Award "FIFA Fair Play Award")\n\n| Winner | Team | Reason |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| [Luka Lochoshvili](/wiki/Luka_Lochoshvili "Luka Lochoshvili") | [Wolfsberger AC](/wiki/Wolfsberger_AC "Wolfsberger AC") | Saved [Georg Teigl](/wiki/Georg_Teigl "Georg Teigl")\'s life, clearing the defender’s airways after he swallowed his tongue. Thanks to Lochoshvili\'s actions, Teigl regained consciousness and then was treated at a local hospital.[[35]](#cite_note-:0-35) |\n\n### The Best FIFA Special Award\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Special Award")]\n\nAn additional award was given out posthumously in tribute to the late [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé"), to recognize his role and contribution to the sport of football. The award was received by Pelé\'s wife Marcia Aoki.[[36]](#cite_note-36)\n\n| Winner | Reason |\n| --- | --- |\n| [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé") | Posthumously awarded as a tribute and special recognition for his role in football. |\n\n### FIFA FIFPRO Men\'s World 11\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Men\'s World 11")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")\n\nThe 26–player men\'s shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[37]](#cite_note-37)\n\nThe players chosen were [Thibaut Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois") as goalkeeper, [Achraf Hakimi](/wiki/Achraf_Hakimi "Achraf Hakimi"), [Virgil van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van Dijk") and [João Cancelo](/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Cancelo "João Cancelo") as defenders, [Kevin De Bruyne](/wiki/Kevin_De_Bruyne "Kevin De Bruyne"), [Casemiro](/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") and [Luka Modrić](/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić") as midfielders, and [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi"), [Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema"), [Erling Haaland](/wiki/Erling_Haaland "Erling Haaland") and [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") as forwards.[[38]](#cite_note-38)[[39]](#cite_note-39)\n\n**[Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois")**\n\n**[Van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van "Manchester United F.C.") * [Al Nassr](/wiki/Al_Nassr_FC "Al Nassr FC") |\n\n### FIFA FIFPRO Women\'s World 11\n\n[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=13 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Women\'s World 11")]\n\nSee also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")\n\nThe 23–player women\'s shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[40]](#cite_note-40)\n\nThe players chosen were [Christiane Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler") as goalkeeper, [Lucy Bronze](/wiki/Lucy_Bronze "Lucy Bronze"), [Mapi León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León"), [Wendie Renard](/wiki/Wendie_Renard "Wendie Renard") and [Leah Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Leah Williamson") as defenders, [Lena Oberdorf](/wiki/Lena_Oberdorf "Lena Oberdorf"), [Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") and [Keira Walsh](/wiki/Keira_Walsh "Keira Walsh") as midfielders, and [Sam Kerr](/wiki/Sam_Kerr "Sam Kerr"), [Beth Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead") and [Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan") as forwards.[[41]](#cite_note-41)[[42]](#cite_note-42)\n\n**[Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler")**\n\n**[León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León")**\n\n**[Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Leah Williamson")**\n\n**[Bronze](/wiki/Lucy_Bronze "Lucy Bronze")**\n\n**[Renard](/wiki/Wendie_Renard "Wendie Renard")**\n\n**[Walsh](/wiki/Keira_Walsh "Keira Walsh")**\n\n**[Oberdorf](/wiki/Lena_Oberdorf "Lena Oberdorf")**\n\n**[Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas")**\n\n**[Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead")**\n\n**[Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan # The Best FIFA Football Awards 2022

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

[**Sorry to interrupt, but our fundraiser won't last long.**
This Saturday, we ask you to join the 2% of readers who give. If everyone reading this right now gave just $2.75, we'd hit our goal quickly. $2.75 is all we ask.](#)

September 6: Knowledge is human.

We're sorry we've asked you a few times recently, but it's Saturday, September 6—please don't wait until tomorrow to help. We're happy you consult Wikipedia often. If just 2% of our most loyal readers gave $2.75 today, we'd reach our goal quickly. Most readers donate because Wikipedia is useful, others because they realize knowledge needs humans. If you agree, please give. Any contribution helps, whether it's $2.75 one time or monthly.

25 years ago Wikipedia was a dream. A dream built piece by piece by people, not machines. Now, with 65 million articles and 260,000 volunteers across the world, Wikipedia is proof that knowledge is human—a place of free, collaborative, and accessible knowledge. Your donation isn't just supporting a website; it's investing in the world's largest collaborative project of human intelligence—crafted by humans, for humans. Please join the 2% of readers who give what they can to help keep Wikipedia strong and growing. Thank you.

| |  |  |  | | --- | --- | --- | | ← [2021](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2021 "The Best FIFA Football Awards 2021") **·** | [The Best FIFA Football Awards](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards "The Best FIFA Football Awards") | **·** [2023](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2023 "The Best FIFA Football Awards 2023") → | | |

**The** **Best FIFA Football Awards 2022** were held on 27 February 2023 in Paris, France.[[2]](#cite_note-circular-1829-2)

## Winners and nominees

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Winners and nominees")]

### The Best FIFA Men's Player

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men's Player")]

See also: [The Best FIFA Men's Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Men's Player")

Fourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[3]](#cite_note-nominees-3) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[4]](#cite_note-4)

[Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the award with 52 scoring points.[[5]](#cite_note-5)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[8]](#cite_note-8)

The selection criteria for the men's players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022.

[Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé")

[Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema")

| Rank | Player | Club(s) played for | National team | Points |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| The finalists | | | | |
| 1 | [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") | [Paris Saint-Germain](/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C. "Paris Saint-Germain F.C.") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") | 52 |
| 2 | [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") | [Paris Saint-Germain](/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C. "Paris Saint-Germain F.C.") | [France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") | 44 |
| 3 | [Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | [France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") | 34 |
| Other candidates | | | | |
| 4 | [Luka Modrić](/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | [Croatia](/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team "Croatia national football team") | 28 |
| 5 | [Erling Haaland](/wiki/Erling_Haaland "Erling Haaland") | * [Borussia Dortmund](/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund "Borussia Dortmund") * [Manchester City](/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C. "Manchester City F.C.") | [Norway](/wiki/Norway_national_football_team "Norway national football team") | 24 |
| 6 | [Sadio Mané](/wiki/Sadio_Man%C3%A9 "Sadio Mané") | * [Liverpool](/wiki/Liverpool_F.C. "Liverpool F.C.") * [Bayern Munich](/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich "FC Bayern Munich") | [Senegal](/wiki/Senegal_national_football_team "Senegal national football team") | 19 |
| 7 | [Julián Álvarez](/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") | * [River Plate](/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate "Club Atlético River Plate") * [Manchester City](/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C. "Manchester City F.C.") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") | 17 |
| 8 | [Achraf Hakimi](/wiki/Achraf_Hakimi "Achraf Hakimi") | [Paris Saint-Germain](/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C. "Paris Saint-Germain F.C.") | [Morocco](/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") | 15 |
| 9 | [Neymar](/wiki/Neymar "Neymar") | [Paris Saint-Germain](/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C. "Paris Saint-Germain F.C.") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team") | 13 |
| 10 | [Kevin De Bruyne](/wiki/Kevin_De_Bruyne "Kevin De Bruyne") | [Manchester City](/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C. "Manchester City F.C.") | [Belgium](/wiki/Belgium_national_football_team "Belgium national football team") | 10 |
| 11 | [Vinícius Júnior](/wiki/Vin%C3%ADcius_J%C3%BAnior "Vinícius Júnior") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team") | 10 |
| 12 | [Robert Lewandowski](/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski") | * [Bayern Munich](/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich "FC Bayern Munich") * [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona "FC Barcelona") | [Poland](/wiki/Poland_national_football_team "Poland national football team") | 7 |
| 13 | [Jude Bellingham](/wiki/Jude_Bellingham "Jude Bellingham") | [Borussia Dortmund](/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund "Borussia Dortmund") | [England](/wiki/England_national_football_team "England national football team") | 3 |
| 14 | [Mohamed Salah](/wiki/Mohamed_Salah "Mohamed Salah") | [Liverpool](/wiki/Liverpool_F.C. "Liverpool F.C.") | [Egypt](/wiki/Egypt_national_football_team "Egypt national football team") | 2 |

### The Best FIFA Men's Goalkeeper

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men's Goalkeeper")]

See also: [The Best FIFA Goalkeeper](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Goalkeeper "The Best FIFA Goalkeeper")

Five players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[9]](#cite_note-9) The three finalists were revealed on 8 February 2023.[[10]](#cite_note-10)

[Emiliano Martínez](/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") won the award with 26 ranking points.[[11]](#cite_note-11)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[12]](#cite_note-12)

| The finalists | | | | |
| 1 | [Emiliano Martínez](/wiki/Emiliano_Mart%C3%ADnez "Emiliano Martínez") | [Aston Villa](/wiki/Aston_Villa_F.C. "Aston Villa F.C.") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") | 26 |
| 2 | [Thibaut Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | [Belgium](/wiki/Belgium_national_football_team "Belgium national football team") | 20 |
| 3 | [Yassine Bounou](/wiki/Yassine_Bounou "Yassine Bounou") | [Sevilla](/wiki/Sevilla_FC "Sevilla FC") | [Morocco](/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") | 14 |
| Other candidates | | | | |
| 4 | [Alisson](/wiki/Alisson_Becker "Alisson Becker") | [Liverpool](/wiki/Liverpool_F.C. "Liverpool F.C.") | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team") | 8 |

### The Best FIFA Men's Coach

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Men's Coach")]

See also: [The Best FIFA Football Coach](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Coach "The Best FIFA Football Coach")

Five coaches were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[13]](#cite_note-13) The three finalists were revealed on 9 February 2023.[[14]](#cite_note-14)

[Lionel Scaloni](/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni "Lionel Scaloni") won the award with 28 scoring points.[[15]](#cite_note-15)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[16]](#cite_note-16)

| 1 | [Lionel Scaloni](/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni "Lionel Scaloni") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") | 28 |
| 2 | [Carlo Ancelotti](/wiki/Carlo_Ancelotti "Carlo Ancelotti") | [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") | 17 |
| 3 | [Pep Guardiola](/wiki/Pep_Guardiola "Pep Guardiola") | [Manchester City](/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C. "Manchester City F.C.") | 12 |
| Other candidates | | | |
| 4 | [Walid Regragui](/wiki/Walid_Regragui "Walid Regragui") | * [Wydad AC](/wiki/Wydad_AC "Wydad AC") * [Morocco](/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team "Morocco national football team") | 10 |
| 5 | [Didier Deschamps](/wiki/Didier_Deschamps "Didier Deschamps") | [France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team") | 5 |

### The Best FIFA Women's Player

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women's Player")]

See also: [The Best FIFA Women's Player](/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Women%27s_Player "The Best FIFA Women's Player")

Fourteen players were initially shortlisted on 12 January 2023.[[17]](#cite_note-17) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[18]](#cite_note-18)

[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") won the award with 50 scoring points, her second consecutive win.[[19]](#cite_note-19)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[20]](#cite_note-20)

The selection criteria for the women's players of the year was: respective achievements during the period from 7 August 2021 to 31 July 2022.

[Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas")

[Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan")

[Beth Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead")

| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

| 1 | [Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") | [Spain](/wiki/Spain_women%27s_national_football_team "Spain women's national football team") | 50 |
| 2 | [Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan") | * [Orlando Pride](/wiki/Orlando_Pride "Orlando Pride") * [San Diego Wave](/wiki/San_Diego_Wave_FC "San Diego Wave FC") | [United States](/wiki/United_States_women%27s_national_soccer_team "United States women's national soccer team") | 37 |

"Manchester City W.F.C.") * [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") | [England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women's national football team") | 0 |

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=6 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Women's Goalkeeper")]

[Mary Earps](/wiki/Mary_Earps "Mary Earps") won the award with 26 scoring points.[[23]](#cite_note-23)[[6]](#cite_note-voting_results-6)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)[[24]](#cite_note-24)

### FIFA Puskás Award

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: FIFA Puskás Award")]

See also: [FIFA Puskás Award](/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award "FIFA Puskás Award")

The eleven players initially shortlisted for the award were announced on 12 January 2023.[[29]](#cite_note-29) The three finalists were revealed on 10 February 2023.[[30]](#cite_note-30) All goals up for consideration were scored from 8 August 2021 to 18 December 2022. Every registered FIFA.com user was allowed to participate in the final vote until 3 February 2023, with the questionnaire being presented on the official website of FIFA. The selected goals were also voted on by a panel of "FIFA experts". Both groups' votes weighed equally on the ultimate winner of the award.[[31]](#cite_note-31)

[Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") won the award with 21 scoring points, becoming the first [amputee footballer](/wiki/Amputee_football "Amputee football") to earn the honour.[[32]](#cite_note-32)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)

| Rank | Player | Match | Competition | Date | Points |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| The finalists | | | | | |
| 1 | [Marcin Oleksy](/wiki/Marcin_Oleksy "Marcin Oleksy") | **[Warta Poznań](/wiki/Warta_Pozna%C5%84 "Warta Poznań")** – [Stal Rzeszów](/wiki/Stal_Rzesz%C3%B3w_(football) "Stal Rzeszów (football)") | 2022 PZU Amp Futbol Ekstraklasa | 6 November 2022 | 21 |
| 2 | [Dimitri Payet](/wiki/Dimitri_Payet "Dimitri Payet") | **[Marseille](/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille "Olympique de Marseille")** – [PAOK](/wiki/PAOK_FC "PAOK FC") | [2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Europa_Conference_League "2021–22 UEFA Europa Conference League") | 7 April 2022 | 20 |
| 3 | [Richarlison](/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") | **[Brazil](/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team "Brazil national football team")** – [Serbia](/wiki/Serbia_national_football_team "Serbia national football team") | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 24 November 2022 | 17 |
| Other candidates | | | | | |
| Unranked | [Mario Balotelli](/wiki/Mario_Balotelli "Mario Balotelli") | **[Adana Demirspor](/wiki/Adana_Demirspor "Adana Demirspor")** – [Göztepe](/wiki/G%C3%B6ztepe_S.K. "Göztepe S.K.") | [2021–22 Süper Lig](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_S%C3%BCper_Lig "2021–22 Süper Lig") | 22 May 2022 | N/A |
| [Francisco González Metilli](/wiki/Francisco_Gonz%C3%A1lez_Metilli "Francisco González Metilli") | [Rosario Central](/wiki/Rosario_Central "Rosario Central") – **[Central Córdoba](/wiki/Central_C%C3%B3rdoba_de_Santiago_del_Estero "Central Córdoba de Santiago del Estero")** | [2022 Argentine Primera División](/wiki/2022_Argentine_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n "2022 Argentine Primera División") | 1 August 2022 |
| [Amandine Henry](/wiki/Amandine_Henry "Amandine Henry") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Lyon](/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais_F%C3%A9minin "Olympique Lyonnais Féminin")** | [2021–22 UEFA Women's Champions League](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_UEFA_Women%27s_Champions_League "2021–22 UEFA Women's Champions League") | 21 May 2022 |
| [Théo Hernandez](/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") | **[Milan](/wiki/A.C._Milan "A.C. Milan")** – [Atalanta](/wiki/Atalanta_B.C. "Atalanta B.C.") | [2021–22 Serie A](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Serie_A "2021–22 Serie A") | 15 May 2022 |
| [Alou Kuol](/wiki/Alou_Kuol "Alou Kuol") | [Iraq](/wiki/Iraq_national_under-23_football_team "Iraq national under-23 football team") – **[Australia](/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_under-23_soccer_team "Australia men's national under-23 soccer team")** | [2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup](/wiki/2022_AFC_U-23_Asian_Cup "2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup") | 4 June 2022 |
| [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") – **[France](/wiki/France_national_football_team "France national football team")** | [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") | 18 December 2022 |
| [Salma Paralluelo](/wiki/Salma_Paralluelo "Salma Paralluelo") | [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Femen%C3%AD "FC Barcelona Femení") – **[Villarreal](/wiki/Villarreal_CF_(women) "Villarreal CF (women)")** | [2021–22 Primera División (women)](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n_(women) "2021–22 Primera División (women)") | 2 April 2022 |
| [Alessia Russo](/wiki/Alessia_Russo "Alessia Russo") | **[England](/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team "England women's national football team")** – [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden_women%27s_national_football_team "Sweden women's national football team") | [UEFA Women's Euro 2022](/wiki/UEFA_Women%27s_Euro_2022 "UEFA Women's Euro 2022") | 26 July 2022 |

### FIFA Fan Award

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: FIFA Fan Award")]

See also: [FIFA Fan Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fan_Award "FIFA Fan Award")

The award celebrates the best fan moments or gestures of August 2021 to December 2022, regardless of championship, gender or nationality. The shortlist was compiled by a panel of FIFA experts.[[33]](#cite_note-33)

[Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans won the award with over 650,000 registered votes.[[34]](#cite_note-34)[[7]](#cite_note-result_breakdown-7)

| Rank | Fan(s) | Reason | Votes | % of total votes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Nominees | | | | |
| 1 | [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") fans | Their support in travelling to Qatar to support their teams eventual winning run at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"), and followed by the millions of fans welcoming the team home to [Buenos Aires](/wiki/Buenos_Aires "Buenos Aires") following their tournament win. | 656,253 | 41.88% |
| 2 | [Japan](/wiki/Japan_national_football_team "Japan national football team") fans | Traditional nature of staying behind following their nation’s games at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup") to clean up the stadium. | 526,887 | 33.63% |
| 3 | Abdullah Al Salmi | Hiking 1,600 km across the Arabian desert from [Jeddah](/wiki/Jeddah "Jeddah") to Qatar to support his home nation at the [2022 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup "2022 FIFA World Cup"). | 383,643 | 24.49% |

### FIFA Fair Play Award

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: FIFA Fair Play Award")]

See also: [FIFA Fair Play Award](/wiki/FIFA_Fair_Play_Award "FIFA Fair Play Award")

| Winner | Team | Reason |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [Luka Lochoshvili](/wiki/Luka_Lochoshvili "Luka Lochoshvili") | [Wolfsberger AC](/wiki/Wolfsberger_AC "Wolfsberger AC") | Saved [Georg Teigl](/wiki/Georg_Teigl "Georg Teigl")'s life, clearing the defender’s airways after he swallowed his tongue. Thanks to Lochoshvili's actions, Teigl regained consciousness and then was treated at a local hospital.[[35]](#cite_note-:0-35) |

### The Best FIFA Special Award

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: The Best FIFA Special Award")]

An additional award was given out posthumously in tribute to the late [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé"), to recognize his role and contribution to the sport of football. The award was received by Pelé's wife Marcia Aoki.[[36]](#cite_note-36)

| Winner | Reason |
| --- | --- |
| [Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé") | Posthumously awarded as a tribute and special recognition for his role in football. |

### FIFA FIFPRO Men's World 11

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Men's World 11")]

See also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")

The 26–player men's shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[37]](#cite_note-37)

The players chosen were [Thibaut Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois") as goalkeeper, [Achraf Hakimi](/wiki/Achraf_Hakimi "Achraf Hakimi"), [Virgil van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van Dijk") and [João Cancelo](/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Cancelo "João Cancelo") as defenders, [Kevin De Bruyne](/wiki/Kevin_De_Bruyne "Kevin De Bruyne"), [Casemiro](/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") and [Luka Modrić](/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić") as midfielders, and [Lionel Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi"), [Karim Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema"), [Erling Haaland](/wiki/Erling_Haaland "Erling Haaland") and [Kylian Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") as forwards.[[38]](#cite_note-38)[[39]](#cite_note-39)

**[Courtois](/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois")**

**[Van Dijk](/wiki/Virgil_van_Dijk "Virgil van Dijk")**

**[Hakimi](/wiki/Achraf_Hakimi "Achraf Hakimi")**

**[Cancelo](/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Cancelo "João Cancelo")**

**[De Bruyne](/wiki/Kevin_De_Bruyne "Kevin De Bruyne")**

**[Messi](/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi")**

**[Mbappé](/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé")**

**[Modrić](/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87 "Luka Modrić")**

**[Casemiro](/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro")**

**[Benzema](/wiki/Karim_Benzema "Karim Benzema")**

**[Haaland](/wiki/Erling_Haaland "Erling Haaland")**

| --- | --- |
| Goalkeeper | |

### FIFA FIFPRO Women's World 11

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2022&action=edit&section=13 "Edit section: FIFA FIFPRO Women's World 11")]

See also: [FIFA FIFPRO World 11](/wiki/FIFA_FIFPRO_World_11 "FIFA FIFPRO World 11")

The 23–player women's shortlist was announced on 13 February 2023.[[40]](#cite_note-40)

The players chosen were [Christiane Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler") as goalkeeper, [Lucy Bronze](/wiki/Lucy_Bronze "Lucy Bronze"), [Mapi León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León"), [Wendie Renard](/wiki/Wendie_Renard "Wendie Renard") and [Leah Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Leah Williamson") as defenders, [Lena Oberdorf](/wiki/Lena_Oberdorf "Lena Oberdorf"), [Alexia Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas") and [Keira Walsh](/wiki/Keira_Walsh "Keira Walsh") as midfielders, and [Sam Kerr](/wiki/Sam_Kerr "Sam Kerr"), [Beth Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead") and [Alex Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan") as forwards.[[41]](#cite_note-41)[[42]](#cite_note-42)

**[Endler](/wiki/Christiane_Endler "Christiane Endler")**

**[León](/wiki/Mapi_Le%C3%B3n "Mapi León")**

**[Williamson](/wiki/Leah_Williamson "Leah Williamson")**

**[Bronze](/wiki/Lucy_Bronze "Lucy Bronze")**

**[Renard](/wiki/Wendie_Renard "Wendie Renard")**

**[Walsh](/wiki/Keira_Walsh "Keira Walsh")**

**[Oberdorf](/wiki/Lena_Oberdorf "Lena Oberdorf")**

**[Putellas](/wiki/Alexia_Putellas "Alexia Putellas")**

**[Mead](/wiki/Beth_Mead "Beth Mead")**

**[Morgan](/wiki/Alex_Morgan "Alex Morgan")**

**[Kerr](/wiki/Sam_Kerr "Sam Kerr")**

38. **[^](#cite_ref-38 "Jump up")** ["Messi makes World 11 history as Benzema earns maiden inclusion"](https://www.fifa.com/fifaplus/en/articles/fifpro-mens-world-11-2022-benzema-cancelo-casemiro-courtois-de-bruyne-haaland-hakimi-mbappe-messi-modric-van-dijk). *FIFA.com*. Fédération Internationale de Football Association. 27 February 2023. Retrieved 27 February 2023.
39. **[^](#cite_ref-39 "Jump up")** ["Who made the 2022 FIFA FIFPRO Men's World 11?"](https://fifpro.org/en/supporting-players/player-influence/world11/who-made-the-2022-fifa-fifpro-men-s-world-11/). *FIFPRO World Players' Union*. 27 February 2023. Retrieved 27 February 2023.
40. **[^](#cite_ref-40 "Jump up")** ["Revealed: The 2022 FIFA FIFPRO Women's World 11 squad"](https://www.fifa.com/fifaplus/en/articles/revealed-the-2022-fifa-fifpro-womens-world-11-squad). *FIFA.com*. Fédération Internationale de Football Association. 13 February 2023. Retrieved 13 February 2023.
41. **[^](#cite_ref-41 "Jump up")** ["Renard, Bronze and Morgan secure FIFPRO Women's 11 places"](https://www.fifa.com/fifaplus/en/articles/fifpro-womens-world-11-2022-bronze-endler-kerr-leon-morgan-mead-oberdorf-putellas-renard-walsh-williamson). *FIFA.com*. Fédération Internationale de Football Association. 27 February 2023. Retrieved 27 February 2023.
42. **[^](#cite_ref-42 "Jump up")** ["Who made the 2022 FIFA FIFPRO Women's World 11?"](https://fifpro.org/en/supporting-players/player-influence/world11/who-made-the-2022-fifa-fifpro-women-s-world-11/). *FIFPRO World Players' Union*. 27 February 2023. Retrieved 27 February 2023.
